Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a seedy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Hilary0801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in Feb-March 2011. I must admit we had high expectations of this leg of our trip, being Hollywood after all! Unfortunately, we soon realised that Hollywood Blvd is not all we hoped. We found it to be quite dirty, seedy and definitely did not feel safe walking around late at night. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the heart of Hollywood so it is easy to see the famous sites. We arrived the day before the Oscars so the street was mostly blocked off but it was good to see everything set up and we walked along the red carpet at Kodak theatre (no celebrity spotting, sadly!) We hired a car which was great because we could venture out of the city along the coast and we spent a day at Malibu, Universal studios, Warner Bros studios (HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!) and Six Flags theme park. There is also a great shopping centre close by called The Grove which has lots of nice restaurants. Back to the hotel, we found it a bit challenging to drive out of the carpark as North Highland avenue is extremely busy all the time. There is a small supermarket/liquor store and pizza restaurant across the road which came in handy. The breakfast at the hotel is very nice and the staff are helpful. Our room was average, overlooking the dreary streets of LA. I think we were just disappointed overall because we hoped Hollywood would be nicer, but in terms of the hotel itself and the location, we would recommend to anybody keen to visit LA. I think given the little time we actually spent in Hollywood, if we returned we would stay elsewhere further out. I highly recommend hiring a car to get around. The Blvd is bustling with action, characters and tourists but not nearly as "glitzy" and "glamourous" as I expected!

Reviews.Title: “Location is good!”
Reviews.Author: -saiyan-
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short 2 nights, Location was great, within walking distance to the heart of LA. Rooms was clean, but it seemed a little dated though.. The air conditioner was noisy during my stay.. Staff was very friendly and helpful.. Recommended if you are staying for a couple of days in LA.. Oh, i must say, the beds was pretty comfortable! = )

Reviews.Title: “Close to the craziness of the tourist trap !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redrayandredkay
Reviews.Content: Deciding to stay in Hollywood for a night, we chose to stay here because it was close to the walk of fame. And it is not that far from the walk. Check in was pretty quick. Front desk staff nice. The property was clean. Room was clean. Nothing fancy. Was not crazy about paying over $200 for the room and $22 for Valet Parking. And that was a room facing the wall of the pool. Breakfast about what is standard for HIE and personnel working the Breakfast bar kept up pretty well. Probably worse places to stay, but knowing what I know now, would pay to stay somewhere cheaper away from Hollywood and take the public transportation or drive in a pay for parking. Checked "no" for free parking but I think you can get a package which includes free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kerryntrevor
Reviews.Content: Everyone here is lovely. Front desk and housekeepers alike. We arrived a little early and were upgraded to a larger room. This was a great start. The room had a couch, desk, dining table and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast room was nice but there was always a queue of people waiting for a seat. For the amount of guests this hotel holds, I would suggest more tables and a second helper. The location is perfect, only one block away from the kodak theatre and all the kaos of Hollywood Boulevard. For the quality, location and price, I believe this is the best place to stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but quiet”
Reviews.Author: ydnab
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights while in Hollywood. Staff was excellent, especially the valets. Room was clean. Hot breakfast bar was much better than cold pastries at most hotels. Had to take 2 elevators and a little walk to get to room on 8th floor, but it was worth it. Only 5 rooms on the floor and it was nice and quiet! Only a few blocks from the sites on Hollywood Blvd. Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kazzmich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of our stay for 2 nights 2 adults and two Teens (13 & 15). Arrived at 10 am expected to just store our bags, however our room was ready for us, so a shower was first on the agenda. The room was very comfortable and clean. After a freshen up headed out to the Highland centre which was just a 2-5 minute walk away, kids wanted Johnny Rockets for lunch, very nice for just a burger joint, yummy thickshakes. The complimentarty brakfast was more than ample and very fulfilling, better than as stated continintal. Had crispy bacon, scrambled eggs, cinnabon rolls, bagels, pancakes, yoghurt, fruit, coffee and tea. Very enjoyable stay, would recommend for families, very comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Location, friendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: Brazilian_2012
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff!!! The location is very good, just a few steps from the Walk of Fame, Highland Mall and metro station..... The breakfast is very good (but I recommend you to go early - it is always full). Hotel is very clean and beds are really comfortable! Definitely recommend this hotel! It is a little bit expensive, but you will not find a better deal in LA (all hotels are really expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, loved the breakfast bar!”
Reviews.Author: 65Rambler
Reviews.Content: After visiting Disneyland, we stayed here hoping it would be a good base for exploring downtown and areas north and west of LA. It was - the location was excellent for exploring Hollywood - close enough to walk to the strip, but far enough away so it was a bit quieter than if on Hollywood Blvd. Close to a stop on the Metro Red Line for easy car-free (!) access to downtown and beyond. The location was good for car access to Beverly Hills, Wilshire Blvd, Pasadena, Griffith Park, Santa Monica Mts and to Burbank airport. Breakfast bar was excellent - included yogurt, variety of breads and pastry, scrambled eggs, gravy and either bacon or sausage. Our last day, they unveiled a new pancake machine which was pretty cool and actually made ok pancakes. Disappointed they didn't have more fresh fruit, since so much is grown in the region, but... Our room was comfortable and relatively quiet, but the toilet leaked and we had to shut it off at night, as maintenance was never dispatched to fix it during the day (despite our notification) - also had annoying little problems with bathroom lights not always turning on and with a noisy but useless bathroom fan. Parking was by valet and was efficient. Desk staff were friendly. The hotel is inconvenient to access by car if heading north on Highland. We had to drive into the residential area north of the hotel, do a U-turn and return southbound on Highland in order to enter. (It didn't help that our GPS told us the hotel was on the east side of Highland when it was actually on the west side). The pool looks nice, but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Oscar winning location & price”
Reviews.Author: smaken
Reviews.Content: My family was pleasantly surprised to stay visit Hollywood and and stay here the same weekend as the Oscar. We were so close to all the action we walked around and even seen some actors. The area was very secure to walk around during the time we visited but I'm not sure if its always like that. The staff was excellent from the moment we arrived till we checked out. The staff that worked in the breakfast area did a great job. They kept all the food fully stocked and nicely presented. They kept the whole breakfast area clean all the time. The only thing I wasn't happy about is I was told they had a heated pool but it was heat at all. I wish it wasn't represented as heated when it was barley warm and my kids wanted to swim. Overall this is a nice hotel and I would recommend it for families of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: momto2girls
Reviews.Content: So the best thing about this hotel was the location. It was a short walk to the main tourist attractions in Hollywood. So if you want to be IN Hollywood and centrally located this certainly meets that requirement. I felt safe walking with my family to and from the hotel, even at night. One day I went for an early morning run along Hollywood Blvd alone and while there weren't many people out and the street sure looks different without the tourists, I felt safe. The bad news is that you do have to pay for location. We stay at this chain fairly often and we paid almost 3 times what we paid for similar quality hotels in Ca and other places to stay here. Plus, parking was $20/day + tips for the valet. So we found the hotel expensive for what you got but not when compared to this area, just when compared to other places. Rooms were a decent size and there was counterspace in the bathroom. No major complaints, I'd stay here again if I stayed in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Canny_Annie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located an easy walk away from the Walk of Fame and Grauman's and the city tours. The hotel is clean, provides breakfast and the staff are very friendly and willing to help. The room was somewhat basic but very clean and well kept. We were very happy with a decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying in Hollywood- two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: AceAmanda_Au
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in Hollywood. I had been on tours of the area before but never stayed over night. The area is renown for homelessness and prostitution. I was travelling with my husband, 3 children and their grandmother. I wanted somewhere central so we didn't have to spend a fortune on tours/travelling to 'where the action is'. Also travelling with small children, it's very hard to predetermine if they will be able to adventure out of the hotel on any given day. Thankfully, this was the perfect location for us! Being a group of 6, we had to book two rooms at previous stops (which was very expensive) but we were all able to stay in the one room at this hotel. It was spacious and really nice. During our trip we stayed at 4 different hotels and this was everyone's favorite. Internet access was great, breakfast was fine (USA food is not my favorite), there is a pool and gym facility (and they give you additional towels which is something little but helpful). Security into the hotel was good, staff very helpful, the hotel smelt really nice which is good because there are some not so nice smelling areas in the neighbourhood. Originally, I was a little concerned that I wouldn't feel safe with the kids being in the centre of the action. But I felt 100% comfortable and 100% happy with this hotel, the location and the service they provided. The hotel is close enough to be 'in the action' but away enough to stay out of the 'dodgy areas'. I found the hotel very family friendly but if I was traveling alone or with a partner, it would also be great. Because the hotel is so close to everything including Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame, Wax Museum, Universal Studios etc, I was able to save money on shuttle's/ tours to these places. Because of the convenient location, I was also able to buy a bulk discounted theme park ticket and get cheaper admission to the other theme parks including Universal Studios. Often when you purchase theme park tickets they include the shuttle which is generally a couple of hundred dollars more. Because we could catch the train to Universal and buy the discounted entry, I saved around $600. I think people need to remember when staying in an area such as this, there will be homelessness, prostitution and dodgyness but that's the adventure! I highly recommend this hotel. They do a great job with what they have to work with. Very happy customer!!

Reviews.Title: “functional close to hollywood walk of fame”
Reviews.Author: collinsdavies
Reviews.Content: clean & functional ! sums up this accomadation. Location 5/10 min walk to Holly wood strip.price includes self serve b/fast , b/fast includes badles ,muffins,scrambled egg,yoghurts,cold milk cereals tea/coffee altogether a fair start to your day . you cant expect anything grand for this budget acc. bedroom clean , in room safe (no charge) shop around for prices . If you go through US web sites and pay $ it can be cheaper than UK sites Â£ !! fridge also in room ,ice machine available down hall . Q Would i reccomend staying here , Yes it serves a purpose , a place to sleep at a budget price . Enjoy your trip .Oh be aware Taxi fare can be as high as $80 from LAX & $50+ back depending on traffic total $130+

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Complimentary Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tsoltani
Reviews.Content: We just visited LA and stayed in a queen suite at the Holiday Inn Express Walk of Fame. The hotel is an easy block and half walk to Hollywood Blvd & the Kodak Theater. The staff was very nice and helpful at check-in. They gave us a tip on a coupon available for Universal Studios that saved us $15 per person which is a substantial savings. The room was plenty big enough for our party of five, the pull-out couch was your typical style and was fine for our teenage daughter. A microwave and refrigerator in the room was great for keeping snacks handy. The breakfast buffet was really nice, lots of choices and kept full & fresh. My only complaint would be the extra $20. per day charge for parking, which seems high especially at the rates that we paid. We would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Location is what makes this a good bet”
Reviews.Author: Sionel
Reviews.Content: If you want to explore Hollywood then finding a decent hotel at good value can be tricky. This one ticks those two boxes well enough, as you are a few minutes walk - across busy roads - from Hollywood Blvd. It does should "budget" in some areas though (specifically breakfast) so don't expect the sort of luxury you'd get at the nearby W or Rooseveldt, but provided you are aware of this you shouldn't be in for any surprises. The staff were excellent and very helpful and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Not much else you can ask for provided you are not chasing a five-star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: On this trip I've stayed at a Crown Plaza (LAX), Holiday Inn (Miami) and now Holiday Inn Express Hollywood. The holiday Inn Express wins hands down. Big room, big comfortable bed, big bathroom, free Wifi, free breakfast, good location. Very friendly and helpful staff. I think this hotel is not that old and if they can maintain it well and keep up the good work this is a great option for the Hollywood area. The only negative is that it is on a busy road 24hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Great location”
Reviews.Author: jjy88sm
Reviews.Content: An amazing location for a hotel. Just a stones throw from the Avenue of the Stars, Kodak Theatre and Mann's Chinese Theatre. A 3 mile drive to Universal Studios and just a hop skip and a jump to the free ways. Hastings North Avenue is a traffic nightmare in the evenings so if you are coming in from the airport, be prepared to wait. Better yet plan so that flights arrive late enabling you to miss the horrible traffic. Rooms are very large, bathrooms, functional and housekeeping good. I left them a $3 tip everyday on my pillow, just to say thank you and to ensure they paid extra attention. Breakfast was free and abundant. Quality left much to be desired but hey, so long as it filled 5 stomachs, who am I to complain. We went with our three children and stayed three nights. It was worthwhile. Would I go again? Probably!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: debo5513
Reviews.Content: Good location. Room was big and clean but had a horrible repair to carpet in a handicapped room which caused me to trip. Breakfast was good and fresh totally restocked often.STAFF was fantastic and very helpful. Dont like the huge price increase after day one and the 20$ a day to park. Pizza place across strret had good food and delivers but took 1 hr but was worth it

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel if you want to have a look at the Walk of Fame etc”
Reviews.Author: SharleneR
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a fantastic location. The room was fabulous, huge in fact with a very comfortable bed and plenty of room to move around. You could walk to a lot of the local attractions if you were up to the crowds. We spent 3 nights here and had a great time. The down side of the area was that there were a lot of homeless people mooching around. This can be confronting if you don't know your way around. They were not anywhere near the hotel but a few minutes away. The breakfast was again a continental breakfast which included hot eggs, bacon and numerous other goodies 10/10. The people at the hotel were fantastic to deal with and very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: trumpedfinally
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful in every way. The location is perfect- within walking distance of the chinese theatre and walk of fame and only a couple of blocks to the freeway if you are driving. The valet parking rate (valet only parking) is a little steep at $22/day, but actually less expensive than the Hilton next door. The hotel was sold out the night we arrived so a Platinum upgrade was not available but the room we were given was more than adequate. The comparatively large refrigerator was also nice to have. The only area upon which they could improve is to have self parking available and have the valet offer to help with the luggage which he did not.

Reviews.Title: “the real "Hollywood Hotel"!”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to LA, I stayed in this hotel and was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay. The staff from front desk, to housekeeping, to valet were very friendly. Unlike another lodging that bills itself as the "Hollywood Hotel" but isnt, this one is mere steps away from where all the action takes place: The Chinese Theatre, Walk Of Fame, Wax Museum, etc. My favorite part was coming down for breakfast and seeing the wide variety of food available. It's billed as "continental" but I would argue that they went above and beyond that as they had a ton of food waiting for all you hungry travelers! You just cant beat if for the low price!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Affordable Base in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller68
Reviews.Content: Snow in London meant my return to the UK was delayed by one day, so - having stayed Downtown for the earlier part of my stay in LA - I decided to spend the extra night in Hollywood. This Holiday Inn Express has been built next to another hotel, which used to be the Holiday Inn in Hollywood - now part of a different hotel group. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago, so I knew the area well and was happy to give my business to the newer Holiday Inn Express. It is very close to the main Hollywood/Highland Metro (underground) station - just a short walk up pass the expensive Renaissance Hotel - so you are very close to all the sights, shopping and dining areas. You can't stay at a better location. My Platinum Priority Club membership was acknowledged with a room upgrade. My room was on the front of the building and yes, there is road noise that starts around 5am/6am in the morning. The room was medium-sized, with a brightly-lit bathroom and kitchenette. There was a sofa and dining table, which led into the bed area. The under-window-mounted air conditioning unit worked well, though was noisier than wall-vented systems. All the fixtures and fittings were in good condition, well-maintained and the furnishings were comfortable. The free WiFi service worked well. This hotel is unusual in that the "main floor" is on the 4th floor, which is where you'll find the breakfast room, business centre, fitness area and outdoor swimming pool. Breakfast was the usual hot and cold buffet breakfast. If you know what to expect, then you won't be disappointed. I prefer the healthier options on offer at Holiday Inn Expresses in the UK, but I was still happy with the selection I found here. The staff here are very personable and make you feel very welcome. There's a snack shop just behind the reception desk, where you can buy a small range of items that you can prepare in your in-room microwave. In the evenings, security is enhanced to give guests extra peace of mind. I didn't drive, but the hotel has a good-sized undercover car park. In summary, if you can get a room here, then you'll have a good value-for-money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great for families or business travel”
Reviews.Author: ADK28
Reviews.Content: This is your typical high-quality HI Express, within a 10 minute walk to the Kodak Theater area of Hollywood Blvd, including the Hollywood-Highland station on Metro's Red Line. Hollywood Bowl appears to be about a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction. The staff is very friendly, and the hotel has an outdoor pool and great free breakfast. Covered parking is on-site, though I don't know what they charge, as I took Metro everywhere I went. Hotel is on a busy street, yet the neighborhood appeared safe, and my room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks All The Boxes”
Reviews.Author: FRAMO_2887
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked to stay at a better hotel, seriously! There's so many positive things that this hotel has going for it. Let's get started: First of all, it's in a great location! Literally a five minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard which means that you don't need to catch a cab to get there. And once you reach Hollywood Boulevard, you're in the prime location to catch the train or a bus (which is how we got around because the transportation is great). Another great thing is that when you walk out of the hotel, just look to the left towards the mountains and you will see that famous Hollywood sign perched on the hills it owns! Starbucks is just across the road so you can get your morning coffee. The staff are so helpful. Every time we walked through the lobby they would greet us with a smile and if we needed directions or help they would be happy to give us advice. Never, for the six nights we were there did we once have a problem. They were always willing to help. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. After a long day of sightseeing, we'd come to a room that has been cleaned and made for us! Was always tidy. The rooms have a safe so you can put your valuables in there and comes with free wi-fi. There is also washing facilities there for your clothes. Some other misc. points are that this hotel has complimentary breakfast, which is where we ate every morning before our day trips. This hotel is in a safe location and is perfect for anyone, families, couples or adventurous tourists like me. I would (and will) definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: foreveramum
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 adults stayed here.The rooms were clean, quiet and the breakfast variety amazing. Juanita in the breakfast room was courteous and efficient and greeted each person as they came to dine.A short walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame etc. and short car trip to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: 801stale
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel in Hoolywood this is it.Big clean rooms and the staff is exellent. Short and easy acces to everthing.I will recommend it to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: Maymap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the Hollywood Walk of Fame area, within close walking distance to Runyan Canyon, restaurants, Jimmy Kimmel's show, the Kodak and Grauman's theatres. However, the access to the parking area from Highland is pretty impossible. Too many lanes of cars, high traffic area, makes it too difficult to navigate in and out of the valet serviced parking garage. The hotel and city need to create a solution, as we saw a multi car vehicle accident and witnessed many near ones. It shouldn't be such a headache to get in and out of the hotel attached garage and there's no other way to approach the hotel via car.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: marrina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn with my boyfriend for four days in February. The folks at the front desk were extremely friendly and accommodating upon our arrival. I misplaced my ID and had a mild panic attack, but they let us check-in with my boyfriend's ID. We had to take 2 elevators to our room, which wasn't that big of a deal. The room was big and clean; the bathroom as well. The bed was SUPER comfy. We were able to control the temperature from inside the room, which was perfect. The AC can get a bit loud at times, but we weren't bothered by it. The room has a safe that we used to store our iPads, jewelery, etc. when we were out and about. The hotel is very quiet; we could not hear the noise from other rooms, or from the outside. The hotel is 2 blocks away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theater, etc. We did not have a car, so it was perfect for us to be walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “superb value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: Thw hotel is a 5 minute stroll from Hollywood Boulevarde and the walk of fame. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby and close to the tour bus routes. Nice large rooms with aircon and breakfast is included. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Highly reccomend this value for money hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Brumm11
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our trip to Hollywood. Check I'm was a breeze, staff were very friendly. Our room was very large, comfy bed and couch, partial view of the Hollywood sign. Bathroom was clean and a standard HIE bathroom. The breakfast was fantastic with good choices. It was always nice and clean and quiet in there(we were early risers). Checkout was fast and easy as well. The valet staff were great. However we were charged $22 a day yet the sign outside said $20 a day. We didn't realize until we got home. But $8 isn't much to fuss over. The location kinda seems "sketchy" but after wandering around West Hollywood, the whole place seems that way. However we never had an problems. So that in no way is HIE fault. Overall we had a fantastic stay and fantastic staff. If we were to go back we would stay there or another HIE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for you and your car to visit the Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: ikar77
Reviews.Content: Usually it's not very easy to say something special about the chain hotel, like Holiday Inn Express Hotel, because it's absolutely predictable words. Yes, it was very clean, yes the staff was helpful and stay was very pleasant. Free WiFi and car parking are also available in the Holiday Inn Express Hotel. But! In this hotel the main advantage is the location. It's the middle between Hollywood Bowl and Hollywood Walk of Fame. If you are going to visit the concert in Hollywood Bowl you definitely need to stay in this hotel, because it's the best place to stay and to park your car. The only one thing I need to mention is the noise from the road, especially during the concert in Hollywood Bowl, because thousands of people are pass by the hotel. So in general it's a good place to stay for few days in LA.

Reviews.Title: “great value walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: wandererplus4
Reviews.Content: we stayed here end of December 2010 and it was brilliant. We had a family suite and it was ridiculous value, so well priced we were expecting very average and got incredible value. The location is within walking distance to walk of fame, all of the attraction ie wax museum, world records ect, the hollywood home tours bus stops, so many eating places and brilliant shopping centre, you couldnt get a better location that felt safe to walk to and from. We enjoyed a complimentary bkfst each morning and it did the job, good eggs, bit of carb, yoghurt, juice and maybe a fruit so anyone having a whinge just cant be pleased with much, i quote complimentary and the lady that runs the breakfast room is so efficient, keeps the room tidy and clean and nothing is too much trouble she is a gem. All the staff made us feel so wecome and looked after a treat, so if we are ever in Hollywood again this is the place for us, oh and quick walk and train to Universal Studio, toooo easy...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room for larger family”
Reviews.Author: AussieTaylors
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in a beautiful and comfortable 2 queen suite with sofabed. It was clean comfortable and so close to everything Hollywood. We walked to the walk of fame, hollywood&highland shopping centre, Madame tussade's and the metro train to universal studios. The free breakfast was great - I especially liked the warm cinnamon rolls. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful, storing our baggage both before our room was available and after we checked out and arranging airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: FightOnRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a Saturday night. I was going to the Magic Castle and didn't want to drive home after imbibing. Now honeslty this is a Holiday Inn,,not the Ritz. The rooms were standard fare (I did get the basic room) with cable TV and a fridge. Extremely clean (the room and the lobby). Personell working there were very friendly (valet parking guy was the best). I was there with another couple that stayed in the room next to us and our rooms were ready early and they let us in which was appreciated. I will say that my room was rather noisy,,not from neighbors or traffic in the hallway,,but equipment noise that went on all night long. Thumping and sounds like walking in the room behind us,,yet there was no room behind us. A few times there was a roar as though a jet engine was warming up for takeoff. My friends were in the room next to us and heard none of that,,so DO NOT stay in room 307 ! BTW,,earplugs solved the noise polution. Nice looking pool,,but we weren't there to swim. The free breakfast was very good and filling,,,pancakes, bacon, eggs,,not bad at all. So would I recommend this to an out of towner? yes. As the title of my review states,,location location location. From this hotel you can get to virtually everything people come to Hollywood to see,,Grauman's Chinese, Kodak theatre, the Hollywood Bowl and you can do this by walking. Nothing is further then 1/2 mile or so from here except the Pantages. That is why I stayed here,,walked to and from the Magic Castle. Driving around this area is the worst and had we tried to drive to the Magic Castle it would have taken longer then walking. I also think Farmer's Market and the Grove are maybe no more then 2 miles from here. Oh,,it does cost to park your car here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: thbucu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as part of a vacation, and this was probably our best stay in the area. The staff were noticeably courteous and helpful. I was very satisfied with the room, the hot breakfast and the wifi. Parking is valet only and the only small issue was actually getting in and out by car as it is on a very very busy road and at times it was literally impossible to make a left turn, which I wish I had taken into account before I printed my driving directions. There did not seem too many places to eat around the hotel initially but we found a nice small diner called Spice just a few steps up the road in the lobby of the BW. I booked based on the reviews here and found it fully lived up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilySingapore
Reviews.Content: Based on the recommendations of fellow TA members, we booked this hotel for our stay in Dec 2011. Fast check in & equally efficient fast check out. The hotel though small has very nice rooms. We like the deco of the room & the comfy beds. Breakfast is adequate. Hotel staff are very helpful indeed. We asked for direction to Citadel Factory Outlet & then to San Diego & the female staff on duty at the front desk actually printed a map for us which we have never come across such service. Excellent service especially since this is a no frills hotel!! Do be aware that this hotel is located on a busy road with many cars & even noise. If possible, as for a room facing away from the road. There is a nice Japanese eatery opposite the hotel which we had great meals or you may drive around for more food choices. Drive out early as there are constantly many cars as this is afterall Los Angeles!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location to hollywood bowl”
Reviews.Author: Jarek_Yaroslav
Reviews.Content: stayed there to enjoy walking distance to hollywood bowl, where we went to a national concert. location is definitely the best part of the hotel. otherwise, it is very overpriced (even using my company corporate discount got $250) and the rooms lack any character or charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KrystleJones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Holiday Inn Express for 8days January 2012. We have had a brilliant stay. The rooms are lovely. Beds and linen very comfortable. Easy walk to shops and restaurants. We have had a fantastic time. I would highly recommend the hotel. Breakfast lovely. Hotel is heated which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: tsbright
Reviews.Content: The staff and service here are both very good. This was the first hotel we stayed in on our five week trip through the USA and Canada. It was also the only hotel where reception called us after we had checked in to ensure that we had everything we needed and that our room was satisfactory. It was also the only place we stayed in where we were asked how we intended to travel around i.e. own car, taxi, public transport. We were using public transport and were then given a list of attractions and directions on how to get there using buses. A buffet breakfast is included in the room price and for our two teenagers was an excellent option. The room was spacious and clean as was the bathroom. Our only issue during our stay was the room heating/air conditioning. We were unable to control the temperature which meant for some very dry hot nights. We would have opened the windows but the larger suites such as ours overlook N.Highland Ave which is very busy and quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tatchick4
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to finish off our around the world trip as Hollywood/LA was our last stop before heading home... We were very disappointed! We arrived late after our flight was delayed only to encounter a young lady at the reception called "Mickey". We didnt even receive a hello or welcome from her. Great start I thought, it appears we were disturbing her for checking in so late (which was beyond our control). We inquired about late checkout only to be told that the latest we could have the room for was 1pm and 1 minute past that time we would incur a full day rate and not the rate you received when you booked our normal rate but which would be $199 US Ok so no late check out off to a great start. Don't get me wrong I don't judge a person on first appearances so I thought I would cut her some slack as she might have been having a bad day etc, But it appears I was wrong she speaks and treats everybody the same way! The hotel is located on a very very busy road (6 lane highway) that bad that on the second night there was a car accident directly out the front of the hotel in which a car completely uprooted a steel street light and mounted the hotels front garden, luckily no pedestrians or on coming traffic were in the near vicinity. Breakfast was included in the room rate which was very basic by American standards It appeared it was cooked off site and brought in every morning, the same thing everyday except that every second day it would be sausage instead of crispy over cooked bacon! The cook even pre-salted the scrambled eggs for us..... too much some mornings. One morning we decided to have cereal but couldn't as the milk was past its use/best by date not good for a chain hotel! The one and only positive I can say about the hotel was that the beds were clean and comfortable. During our trip we have stayed in various rated hotels even older style hotels that weren't as modern looking as this one but this hotel was the worst by far, so when you look at the greeting from the reception staff, the busy road outside and the same breakfast with poor quality basic food I would not recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnBlue
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a fantastic value! Very nicely appointed rooms, hotel is clean throughout and the staff could not be nicer. It wasa convenient to Hollywood Boulevard, but also convenient for driving. We were there 5 nights for the Rose Parade and drove into Pasadena each day. It was easy access to the roads. The rooms facing the street are a bit noisy if you are a light sleeper, but the staff moved us to a quieter room at the back of the hotel. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kane82
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults & 2 kids, ages 7 & 10) stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March of 2011. Our room was located on the same floor as the business ctr. & breakfast room. It was spacious & had 2 Queen sized beds, a desk w/ a chair, small sink, coffee maker, microwave & refrigerator. Bathroom was spacious w/ usually amenities such as hairdryer, soap etc. Hotel was quiet even though it is located on a busy street; in walking distance to Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater & small shopping mall w/ restaurants. Complimentary continental breakfast: hot/cold cereals, hot/cold beverages, fresh fruit (oranges, apples, bananas), yogurt, pastries (muffins, bagels, breads). Fee for parking. Staff was extremely friendly & efficient. Check in/out was quick. Mini-mart, Subway & Italian restaurant located directly across of hotel. We had an enjoyable stay @ this hotel & highly recommend it to other travels, especially ones w/ children.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: laygatelad
Reviews.Content: I like holiday Inn express and this one did not disappoint.Rooms were large and comfortable and ,in typical american style, provided two large beds per room.Breakfast was very reasonable and a special mention for the ever-smiling employee in charge of the breakfast area.We did not try the pool but it looked like an an excellent facility.The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from the metro system , which can whisk you just about anywhere in LA.The station is right on hollywood boulevard, location of the kodak theatre and the chinese cinema. The hotel's combination of cost , location and quality must be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and well appointed bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Holiday Inn Express Walk of Fame. Excellent friendly staff, good location and above all well appointed bedrooms for both leisure and business. I highly recommend this hotel if you want something near to all the action is West Hollywood. The internet is free and quick.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay in the room below fitness center, you have to get up before 6:00 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnybubbli
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed one night during our trip to LA last month. The hotel was located in a walking distance to the Hollywood walk of fame and less than a 15 minute drive to Griffith observatory and Getty center. The room was very clean and the staff in the front desk was very kind and accommodating. Free breakfast was OK though not impressive. Our room was located right below the fitness center, and we couldn't sleep after 6:00 a.m. becuase of the noise coming from the tradmill in the fitness center. I had to call the front desk twice to stop the noise. When we came back to the room after the breakfast, the tradmill noise resumed and we could not take a rest at the room. Considering that comfort and sleep quality are two main concerns when we choose the hotel is 'comfort,' this hotel was the worst choice in our trip to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TanFamily_123
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults, 2 children aged 12 and 15 years) had stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hollywood Walk of Fame at Los Angeles at Highland Avenue in December 2011 and I must say, it was just wonderful in true â€˜Holiday Inn Expressâ€™ style. I had communicated directly with Corey Bouche from the hotel prior to booking our room and right from the onset, Corey was courteous and quick to reply, and for his helpfulness, I told him that he and the Holiday Inn Express had already made us feel welcome even before we stepped into their premises! Well, we werenâ€™t disappointed â€“ from the cheery and informative Front Desk personnel to its amazing breakfasts to its location which incidentally, was just a mere 10 minute walk from the Hollywood Walk of Fame (the one and only) plus Graumanâ€™s Chinese Theatre (starsâ€™ handprints and footprints) as these 2 must-see Hollywood attractions were really right around the corner from the hotel! From the nearby street, we could have our fill of restaurants, shopping centres, cinema halls, souvenir shops and Star Line Tour operators which had a â€˜Hop On-Hop Offâ€™ facility on open-topped buses taking you to where you wanted to go for your sight-seeing excursions â€“ be it Farmersâ€™ Market, Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive and more. The Holiday Inn Express at Hollywood Walk of Fame is certainly a hotel Iâ€™d recommend for anyone wanting to be near the must-see tourist spots in good old Hollywood! Thanks, Corey â€“ and the team at HIE â€“ for a truly memorable holiday! Itâ€™s two thumbs up from our family!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ladybird859
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 mights in mid November, and from the moment we set foot in the door the staff were friendly and helpful. Never too busy to answer questions or find out information for us. Free Wi Fi was great and a printer was available if you needed it, also for free. The room was facing a busy road but we didn't really hear much noise, I'm sure you could ask for a quieter one if this was an issue. Our room was spacious and clean, but hot water was sometimes an issue. The included breakfast was a bonus - a little different than what we are used to but welcomed none the less. The dining room staff were always friendly. The hotel is just a short stroll from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, many restaurants and the Metro, which was very convenient. All in all a very pleasant place to stay. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “To be or Not to be a IHG Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: Check in was poor and should have been better as I had previously emailed and had two responses. Upgraded to a suite but it was at the front of the Hotel facing a 8 lane busy all night highway. Manny a manager called to see how we were after day one and I mentioned I slept badly. Within 15 minutes he has us moved to a room of the main road and it was perfect. The breakfast is included and has all sorts of different things enough to satisfy most tastes. The hotel is very close to, just 5 minutes walk to Kodak theatre, walk of fame, Chinese Theatre a a reall hot and rocking Hard Rock Cafe. Excellent locality. Very nice rooms. Good bathrooms. Only down side is it has no room service but there's plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Thankyou Manny for your superb attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: joerizzo123
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to LA over Christmas break. I chose this hotel because it was close to the Chinse Theatre and the Hollywood sign, etc. It was a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I got side swiped by a girl in LA that did some damage to my rent-a-car. Garrett at the front desk was very helpful in helping me find a body shop to assist us. Their maintenance guy even came out with his tool box and tried to help repair some of the damage. Even though Hollywood is kind of a scary part of town, the hotel felt very safe. The cars are kept in a garage and a 24 hour attendant is on duty. The breakfast is typical Holiday Inn quality but it is on the 4th floor which keeps it contained to just guests. A good stay. If you are looking for a place in the middle of the tourist action in LA that is affordable and safe, this is the place. One note: booking it directly with the hotel may be much cheaper than expedia or any of those other booking agents. Plus you get your priority points.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkBarnesMusic
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure to stay at this hotel for the 4th time on my annual visit to the Los Angeles Music Awards. I can tell you I keep coming back because of the front desk staff, the lady who runs the Breakfast room and the nice cleanly atmosphere and rooms of the hotel. The front desk staff are professional in their attitude and appearance and a hell of a lot of fun. They sure made my stay even that much better and the same people have been there for the past 4 years and remember me each time I have come back even though it's only for a few days each year. That is majorily impressive in my book and is one of the reasons I love to come back there. The daily hot breakfast is an excellent value and the food is good. When you compare similar hotels and then add the coast of a breakfast this is a much better value for the money. The lady (an I so wish I could remember her name) is an asbolute sweetheart and works her butt off every day to keep the food stocked, the place clean and orderly and everyone who comes through there as happy as can be. She deserves major kudos :-) Overall the hotel is very nice, the rooms are excellent, clean and spacious. It's a great value for the money and I highly recommend it if you are looking to stay in the Hollywood and Hollywood Walk of Fame area. Enjoy Ya'll â™« www.markbarnesmusic.com

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: thiagomarzagao
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very helpful and friendly. The room was quite big and very clean. There was a laundry room (I didn't use it, but it's certainly very handy - in most hotels there is no laundry room for guests and you have to pay like $10 to have a pair of socks washed). Breakfast was ok. Location was quite good, just a 10- or 15-minute walk from the Kodak Theater (where the Oscar ceremony takes place) and the adjoint shopping mall. If all you need is a snack, there is a Starbucks and a 24-hour Subway just across the street. All things considereded, I would stay there again and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: Our room was a king bed room on the 5th floor. The room entailed a king bed, large tv, airconditioning, a seperate area with a 2 seater couch , table for 2, kitchenette with coffee machine, microwave & fridge. Rooms are quiet, no noise from other rooms and clean. The bathroom was a good size with the shower over the bath. The water temperature varied, but it was ok - it was still warm enough. The staff were helpful and friendly, service good. Breakfast was included and is served 6.30 - 9.00am. It is self service and consisted of a good variety of foods. It is not of a high standard, whcih we felt was a let down of the hotel. The location of the hotel is good, a 5 minute walk to the Chinese Theatre, the Hollywood walk of fame, shops, bus stops, train station. As LA is so spread out, hiring a car is a good option. We caught the bus to Santa Monica, hired a tandem bike and rode around the area. Note, Santa Monica is about an hour away by bus.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: The staff here is friendly, sincere,and compitent! Manny, Alfonso,Jessica,Bailey,at the front desk. I am a handfull when I travel asking question all the time. I'm the type of person that walks into a grocery store and immediately ask what isle ice cream on,rather looking for myself. I did not get one negative smirk,sigh,or any feeling like I was bothering them. This is the first time for me to ever write comment for anything! But credit is due here big time. Guillermo,Levy,Anthony at the valet treated me the same as the front desk! Big time professionalism! This professional staff is first class,first rate,and kind. Kudos to Holiday Inn Express at the Holywood Walk of Fame for making my stay an enjoyable one! I know where I will be staying wehn I visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Round”
Reviews.Author: juliahar2
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for the last 4 nights pre cruise - Although nothing special to look at it is a very good location to see the sights of LA as 10 minute walk if that to the Walk of Fame -Kodak and Graumans Theatre which is all very central to buses and tours!! The room we had had 2 king beds and were very comfortable and had choice of soft and firm pillows so we made the most and slept in one each!! Bliss - the room was a good size and good bathroom but for how long you spend in your room we were very happy. Breakfast and wi fi included in the price which is a plus and a good start to the day. Everything was spick and span ! Would definitely recommend to anyone coming to see the sights of LA and the shopping centre next door to the kodak theatre was a nice bonus

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member with Priority Club and usually receive great service from any of their hotels. This hotel was not one of them. It took about 30 to 40 minutes just to check in cause the guy at the front desk said there are no clean rooms in the hotel - not one. I was booked for a suite, but since I had driven there, I wanted to shower and change clothes - so I told him I would take any room. After going back and forth for about 30 minutes, he said, well ok, I do have a clean room. Really? After all of that, he actually did have a clean room?!?! Then, I had to go up to the 5th floor, walk to the back of the hotel and take another elevator up to the 7th floor. Very odd hotel. There are many other hotels in the area that you may want to try.

Reviews.Title: “Location!! Hospitality!! EVERYTHING Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: bellamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectation immensely!! Rooms spacious Clean and brand new. Large bathrooms Fridge in room Free wireless/cable internet Large TV Iron and iron board Clean bed sheets, towels, overall perfect. Hollywood blvd, sunset blvd walking distance, Kodak Theatre, Chinese Mans theatre, shopping, restaurants.... Manny, the hotel receptionist was absolutely wonderful. His attitude and warmth left a lasting impression. It was such a delight, always offered his sincere assistance, greeted and remained professional and happy always. The overall staff at the hotel would go out of their way, but Manny, he stood out with his smile and upbeat personality. This hotel was not your 3star standard Holiday Inn, it was better than many 5 star hotels I've stayed in. The ambience in the room was nothing less than comfortable.. I would recommend it to everyone and anyone, and will certainly make it my number 1 choice when I return. Great for Business and Family stay.. Thank you for a lasting memory and making my stay so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An ok standard spec hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonnieNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Walk of fame, celebrity house tours and Hollywood Bowl, and all the other trashy things. LA locally around the hotel has dirty rubbish on the pavements and streets. Beware the yellow cabs will charge $80 for the taxi from LAX airport, book one at a fixed price with the hotel. Free wi/fi. This hotel has a 'paper and plastic' plate, self service breakfast routine. You cannot get a cup of tea in a nice cup and saucer. Breakfast food is just about ok but no variety each day. Furthermore, you are expected to clear away your own table after breakfast! Really quite unaccepatable for what they charge. The room was adequate, but not in anyway special, in fact you could say that about the whole hotel. Go to the La Brea Tar Pits, very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kdawson1985
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect location to the walk of fame and the small breakfast variety in the morning tops it off as excellent value for money. Foxtel in the room was also one of the better hotel Foxtel's we used while traveling USA. WIFI is complimentary in the room and they also have free computers/printers to use. Only negative comment about this hotel is the shower temperature is cold between 7-10am. I though it was one off but everyday I experience a cold shower in the morning. :(

Reviews.Title: “No complaints -- use your AAA card”
Reviews.Author: KLD1970
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms, quiet sleep. We specifically asked for a quiet room. They put us on the 6th floor and it was perfect. All parking is valet with no pressure to tip each time you're in & out. Definitely drive to the Griffith Observatory if you're in this area & take in one of their films. A little pricey but worth it. The AAA discount is great.

Reviews.Title: “Does what you expect”
Reviews.Author: ADRBROWN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, it was a little dated but for the price I thought represented good value for money. I arrived at 11am and after a 12 hour flight was delighted that my room was ready for me. THe location is good, if doing the walk of fame is your thing (personally I think it is tacky and not much to see there).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prash123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week for three nights. The location is great with walking distance to Hollywood Highland Ave metro station which is a direct metro ride (red line) from Union station. The hotel is very clean and the staff is excellent in maintaining the hotel. There is a microwave in the lobby of you want to reheat your pizza or other food. Room has coffee maker which I personally don't like - I'm a fan of the good old electric kettle. I enjoyed the breakfast as they served various types of healthy oatmeal (incl. plain) along with standard stuff like brown/white bread, cinnamon buns, scrambled eggs, juices, tea, coffee, yoghurts, milk, pancakes, some meat stuff etc. The breakfast area is not very large - so it could get full pretty quickly. It was not a problem for us as we would get very up very early at 6 and crave for food (time difference) :-). The staff is very helpful with directions. Hollywood walk of fame (kodak theatre, chinese grauman etc.) is to your right when you come out of the hotel and hollywood bowl is to your left (easily walkable). Lots of eating points inside Hollywood and Highland mall - it is a very touristy area. So be prepared to get bombarded with people looked to sell you stuff. We just ignored them. You will also find a grocery next to HollyWood and Highland mall and other eating points nearby. The hotel is a bit pricey but I guess it was worth it as the other hotels next to this hotel did not look very attractive from the outside. If you are coming from the airport, just book a super shuttle in advance (32 dollars for two people) to take you to the hotel. Alternatively, you can take the flyaway bus to Union station and then it is a red line metro to Hollywood and Highland AVe station followed by a short walk to the hotel. Los Angeles is a huge spread out city - a bit tasteless for some people. So staying at this hotel provides easy access to Universal Studios, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, Amoeba Music, Highland center, Kodak theatre and Sunset Strip. Rest is far far away. If you are looking to go to Santa Monica or Venice beach - you need to take the 60-90 min bus (733) from Union Station. Be sure not to take this bus in peak time (5-6:30 PM) as it is crammed with people and they don't speak English very well (esp. in Venice). The bus stop is "Main and Grand" for Venice beach. I would not advise staying at Venice beach after dark but it is a great beach (better than Santa Monica). Do take a jumper with you as it can get cold at the beach. The hotel can arrange LA tours - a bit boring but that's the best way to see LA in a short space of time. For me - the best attraction in LA was probably the farmer's market - I found the others bland and tasteless. I definitely recommend this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for AAA members!”
Reviews.Author: a3a21971
Reviews.Content: Awesome hot breakfast! Pool hours could be better (8 to 8)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Friendly staff, Perfect location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: This hotel really impressed me with its service. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty. From the parking attendants to the check-in staff, they couldnâ€™t have been more helpful or accommodating. Our suite was huge and the bed was really comfortable. Shower was good, although some of my colleagues complained about the water temperature. I thought the breakfast was fine â€“ much better than other Holiday Inn Express properties I have stayed in. However, it can get very busy with families and tourists in the morning. The room attendants will give you disposable plates and cutlery if you ask, so you can take your food back to your room. Despite a previous posterâ€™s complaints, it was indeed complimentary. The room was spacious and clean. We had no problems with the WiFi. The large LCD TV was excellent with a huge variety of channels. While our room faced the street, we could hear no noise and slept very well. If I had one complaint, it would be for a hotel of this size, it needs more than one public washer and one public dryer. I also thought that the air conditioning was terribly noisy for a purpose-built hotel. This property offers good value for its location. I would rate it 4 Â½ out of 5 stars and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mummy_8Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for 7 nights. The rooms are very large, clean, and we found the microwave a bonus. Great little group of stores across the road including Starbucks and Subway. Breakfast is basic but in the US a toaster in a big plus (Just no vegemite). Stick to cereal,yogurt,toast, muffins,panckes and bagels and you will be fine. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. We would be happy to stay there again great hotel in what seems to e a safe area. We felt safe walking back from dinner at the Hollywood and Highland centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent location - Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: jamesmaddy
Reviews.Content: For the price and three star rating, we found this hotel very good. The staff were courteous and helpful, Jessica on reception particularly helpful when we arrived at 8am after a long flight. The location is excellent, less than five minutes walk to the Highland Centre and Hollywood Boulevarde, Graumanâ€™s etc and the tour buses. We never felt unsafe or uncomfortable walking back to the hotel at night. The rooms were spacious and adequately furnished, we didnâ€™t have any complaints. The breakfast is just adequate, good to have included in the price although skip the cooked food & go for the cereals / pastries / yoghurt / muffins etc which were fine. Weâ€™d recommend this hotel and we would stay here again on return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: otter1
Reviews.Content: Stayed while daughter was seeing Doctor at Children's Hospital. Had 5th floor 2 queen w/frig. Nice city view, noisy street. Can walk to Kodak Theater & Hollywood/Highland is a lot of fun (but at night, only go in a fairly large group). Only 5 minutes to Universal Studios. Comfortable beds & nice size room. All of the staff was very friendly & helpful from the front desk, valet parking, housekeeping, and dining room, everyone had a smile & were happy to help you. Breakfast was fine - pancake maker, fruit, eggs, bacon, biscuits & gravy, cold cereals,yogurts,bagels & rolls - something for everyone. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position and nice, good value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jende05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from the Kodak theatre, Hollywood and Highland Centre and the walk of fame. The position was fantastic and the rooms comfortable and spacious. The complimentary breakfast was really nice with a lot of variety, cereals, toast, bacon, eggs, pancakes, cinnamon buns, bagels, juice, coffee and more. We really appreciated that there was a laundry room as we had not had that at the previous 3 hotels and were getting smelly, ha ha. The only downside was the room service which is available but not made by the hotel onsite but an independant company and this was edible but not particularly nice. There were cafes and restuarants close by though so I would recommend going for food. The staff at the front desk and breakfast room were all lovely, helpful and polite and we very much enjoyed our stay and would definately recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: samara33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights while honeymooning in the US. This hotel was very clean and quiet and the location was great. The hotel staff were very friendly and the free breakfast was great. The only gripe was the television in our room never had any signal. We had asked at reception for this to be fixed but it never was. No biggie, but after sightseeing all day you sometimes just wanted to chill out and watch the news or a movie in your room. But all in all a great hotel and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sightseeing LA”
Reviews.Author: inlilystime
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fore 4 nights in October. Our room was exactly as described and pictured on the website. We had two double beds, armchair, desk, TV, DVD player, fridge. The bathroom was very clean and water great. The free wifi worked perfectly and I never had any trouble connecting or with the speed (we were on the 5th floor and I logged on at night, if that makes a difference). The breakfast provided was all you'd need, with hot food as well as toast, cereals and pastries etc. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, setting up wake up calls, sending our postcards and also helping arrange a shuttle on the day we left. They also stored our luggage on the last day after we checked out. The hotel is in great proximity to everything. There's a convenience store just across the road as well as a Subway restaurant. It's a very short walk to Hollywood Blvd, including the Hollywood and Highland Centre to shop and we got all our tours from the Chinese Theatre. We also caught the Metro from Hollywood & Highland so that's close too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Hollywood Bvld”
Reviews.Author: travelbuttons
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights earlier this year. The Holiday Inn Express was in a excellent location, just a short walk to Hollywood Boulevard. The room was clean and comfortable, stuff friendly and great buffet breakfast. The only down side was that the wireless internet didn't work in our room otherwise we had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: flowrida
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to get such a good price for a hotel so near Hollywood Boulevard and ever more surprised that it lived up to it's website. We arrived about 11am far too early to get a room and the receptionist was extremely efficient and very pleasant. We put our cases in went of for a day's exploring. When we returned around 3 we were very pleased with our room - so much space! All very clean and had everything we could need. Beds extremely comfortable.. would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: L0uL0uD
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights in LA and wanted to be in the heart of everything. It was 2 blocks from Hollywood Boulevard, Kodak Theatre and subway. Our first impression was a bit disappointing when on our arrival the Porter was too busy talking to his mate to help remove our cases from the cab. They looked a bit casual compared to other places we stayed at during our holiday of the States. The room was spacious and clean, lovely cooked breakfast and even has a coin laundry. There is even a little market in the foyer where you can buy little treats and a microwave for reheating. The free wi fi signal was atrocious, best place was on the 5th floor in the business centre. A nice highlight was on the walk back to the hotel you got a fabulous view of the Hollywood sign, it was even better than when they take you on a tour.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: We originally picked this hotel on Expedia because we have a family of 5 and we were looking for accommodation for our last 3 nights on our US holiday. What luck! The Hotel is in a brilliant location, two blocks away from Hollywood Boulevarde, heaps of transport (including a one stop Metro ride to Universal Studios) and with food options right across the road. But not only was it a great location, it was clean and well-kept, with a good breakfast and a nice pool. And the service of everyone on the front desk and the bell desk could not be faulted. They gave us handy tips (saved us some money on transport with their suggestions), and helped us with a smile whenever we asked. They also have a small shop with well-priced drinks. The only downside was a bit of noise from other guests late at night but that's hardly the fault of the hotel. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option in the heart of La La Land”
Reviews.Author: flora1980
Reviews.Content: This place does exactly what it says on the tin. It's in a great location right next to the Hollywood & Highland Mall, you're practically on the Walk of Fame. The rooms are spacious & well looked after, had all the amenities we needed & a good size bathroom. Breakfast was ok, don't expect anything cooked, just bagels, yoghurts, fruit, cereal etc but it's all included in the price & a buffet so it's a great deal. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: TPa64
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with kids (14,11) for 3 nights. The staff was very helpful. The location is great; plenty of restaurants around near the walk of fame (10 min walk). Free wireless and free buffett breakfast, good business center, pool. The kids enjoyed the increased number of channels offered as well. The price was very reasonable and the $22/day for valet parking is Ok given the price of parking in the area. Laundry facilities great as well.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: ExpectingtheBest77
Reviews.Content: service was nonexistant. rooms were unclean. room beneath cafe so from 430am through 9 am you could hear feet stomping, chairs and tables being moved. no sleep!!!! stay elsewhere. this place is not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Its Name Suggests and Deserving of Its Ranking”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book at a Holiday Inn Express but gave it a try because of the good reviews it receives here on Trip Advisor. The reviewers are right -- this is so much more than an "Express" property. The rooms are spacious, with incredibly comfortable beds and pillows, sofa seating area, kitchenettes with a small fridge, microwave and sink, and large flat-screen TV's (with a wide choice of programming including 9 HBO channels). Wireless internet is free (and worked well) and housekeeping did a great job for each of the 4 days I stayed there. There is a complimentary breakfast served daily until 9:30 am but, as I never tried it, cannot comment on the quality or quantity. There is also a "business center" with 2 computers and a printer and they all worked well. Staff were universally friendly and helpful and, if you are intending to spend a lot of your time in Hollywood, this location cannot be beat as you are less than 10 minutes away by foot. My only complaint would be having to hear my neighbor's every move above me. At least the noise from the street below was minimal as the windows were double-paned.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Regron80
Reviews.Content: This is a great base for exploring Hollywood & surrounding areas, the rooms are clean & comfortable and the breakfasts great. The parking is also a plus. Great value for money & ideal location. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dindan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for two nights in July 2011, This was our first stop of 24 days in California and Nevada . We found it very well located for seeing what Hollywood has to offer most of the main attractions are all walkable. The staff we efficient and friendly. The room was nicely decorated,clean and comfortable. The breakfast was welcome and good, though the breakfast area was crowded. Our room looked inwards on to the pool area, it was nice they had a pool, but do not expect too much here. We did the usual tourist stuff ie hollywood walk of fame which was nearby and the Hollywood forever cemetery which was a long walk, mostly through a distinctly unglamourous area.The car parking was very convenient with Hollywood sized charges but we felt it was better to pick up the hire car ( dollar) at the airport first, rather than go back to collect. If we were going to Hollywood next year we would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beats some 5 star hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Frisco94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we were definitely not disappointed! It was an excellent base for exploring Hollywood being only a couple of blocks away from the main epicentre of many of the key shops, Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre. The room was immaculately clean, very big and with modern facilities, and the bed very comfortable. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was included and consisted of a self service buffet which was fresh, well maintained and with a great range - what a great start to the day! We would definitely stay at this hotel again even though there is a wide range of options. Thanks to everyone at the Holiday Inn Express for making our stay a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Scotty1112
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, staff extremely helpful and friendly. The room (334) had plenty of light and was spacious, the beds were comfy and although we were close to the road th noise was minimal. It's only a short walk to the Hollywood and highland centre with it's transport and entertainment. Great hotel, good value and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Roseme
Reviews.Content: Based on the majority of the glowing reviews on this place, we decided to spend around a week here. I had some initial reservations mainly that it was rated a 2.5-3 star property. However I need not have worried as the place was clean and very comfortable. The room that we stayed in faced away from the main road, so there were no issues with any noise, however in the mornings the room was very dark- we almost had to have lights on all the time. However our room was one of the furthest away from the elevators, and therefore there was no WiFi signal, needed to go out in the hallway. The bathroom is older, but at least it was clean and everything was in good working order. Room was spacious too. I really liked to fact that a simple breakfast was supplied- we were even lucky enough to share a table and a chat one morning with a Grammy award winning artist! Definitely a highlight of the trip! The location is excellent- easily within walking distance of the main attractions and H&H which offers dining options. By using points from the priority club deal we managed to get an excellent rate on the hotel room, so it turned out to be really excellent value- however even without it I think it is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Positive&Nega holiday”
Reviews.Author: Purplewitch83
Reviews.Content: â€¢ Near the metro, Hollywood.. Accessible â€¢ Bed was comfortable â€¢ staff were helpful and friendly â€¢ free breakfast (muffins and bagels were good) â€¢ Bathrooms need to be updated.Â  â€¢ WIfi services was ONLY good at the lobby â€¢ no shuttle going to universal studios â€¢ there were spacious room but ours was small so it looked cramped (lesson: request for a room with a view or the ones near the elevators)Â

Reviews.Title: “Clean and staff are very helpful”
Reviews.Author: saeed42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and close to the metro and universal studio. Free wifi but signal is weak in the bedrooms which might force you to come downstairs so you can get better signal. Breakfast was included

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: RASMAN
Reviews.Content: I was actually upgraded to a "suite" . Good location and close to Hollywood Blvd. Staff very friendly and helpful. Property needs updating. You are definitely paying for location. Ask for a room on the opposite side of the main street as very noisy all night.

Reviews.Title: “In a great location”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeeSydney
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel after a home stay with a friend didn't turn out. Anyhow, the hotel is perfectly located for people wanting to look around Hollywood. The room was a good size and very clean. The beds were super comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Tip...get to breakfast early as seats are limited (we managed to share with other people though) Only two slight negatives 1) the wifi connection was free but a little unreliable in our room. 2) our room was non-smoking but it smelled somewhat like it was a smoking room in a former life. Neither of these issues were deal breakers (despite my aversion to cigarette smells) we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Disney4321
Reviews.Content: Our first stop over in usa,great hotel,nice breakfast,clean rooms and helpful staff. What more could you ask for. Easy access to H'wood Blvd and walk of fame and the metro to universal or santa monica. Cheap public t'port fares are a bonus. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for universal”
Reviews.Author: cardy1964
Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient, nice pool, very friendly staff, very reasonable breakfast, near walk of fame, one easy train stop to universal. Very good hotel, highly recommend. free wifi and and 2 computers for printing stuff out.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kahuna51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HIE a few months ago and had a very enjoyable, pleasant experience. The location is perfect, 2 blocks from Hollywood Blvd.. Between that and the hotel is the Hollywood and Highland shopping and dining complex which is attached to the Kodak Theater which is right next door to Grumman's Chinese Theater. Hollywood and Highland has some cool shops and places to eat. You can stand on the upper floors and roof looking down on Hollywood Blvd. and people watch or just take in the city. The Jimmy Kimmel Theater is right across Hollywood Blvd. as well and since they tape around 5 pm you can watch them tape outside if they are doing any of the crazy stuff they sometimes do. Also on Monday morning as we were walking to go sight seeing some TV show was filming an action scene at the intersection a half block from the hotel....cool stuff. Now about the hotel. The hotel was standard HIE fare, which I consider to be a good thing. Clean, nice, well appointed rooms. With the curtains drawn you wouldn't know if you were in a HIE in Hollywood or Texas....but as their old add said the best surprise is no surprise. Outside though was what was different. Around the pools, the parking garage and different places were painted with huge murals. The whole place had a very nice feel and was very nicely appointed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. BTW we stayed on the 8th floor, in the back part of the hotel. Yeah you have to take two elevators but it was really nice and quiet back there. All in all we had a very nice stay and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Despite a somewhat unattractive street presence (given the car parks either side of the lobby entrance) the Holiday Inn Express Hollywood was very nice once you'd gone through the front doors. Staff were professional and during our visit proved helpful and very pleasant on a day to day basis. Our room was large, clean and comfortable, with a king size bed, well fitted bathroom, TV, WiFi, sofa, desk, and a fridge (not a mini bar). Iron and ironing board were also included in the room together with hair dryer. Getting to the room was bit of a torture - two lifts involved, as the hotel seems to have been built like topsy. So a bit a a rabbit warren. But we soon figured it out. Breakfast was good, hot food, cakes, toast and so on. Juice and coffee tea were available as were (curiously) hard boiled eggs, which I enjoyed. More fruit would have been nice - just banana was offered, although you could have as many as you like. The breakfast area was often packed, and sometimes spilled out into the pool area. The hotel was quite full when we were there (we saw staff having to turn people away), which explains a packed breakfast room. Pool was available - nothing flash, but nice to take a dip at the end of a hot day (music was a bit loud though). The hotel is in Highland Avenue which is a bit scruffy, but very close (5-10 minute walk) to the Hollywood attractions and all the bus tours. also you could jump on a metro bus there to Santa Monica (actually two buses at $1.50 each - 25c for seniors - so $6 for a round trip - about 45 minutes each way). There are plenty of places to eat close by. Also lots of shops. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location & quiet”
Reviews.Author: col5353
Reviews.Content: You dont think its going to be much looking from the street, but the service was fantastic, our room wasnt ready at checkin (the joy of flights arriving from Oz at 0600), but we offered baggage hold, and a place to freshen up, and then ask if we wanted to do a tour or recomendation on somewhere to eat. Taking the option to store our luggage and then head for a walk, we found Hollywood Bvd about a 10 minute walk away.
