When we returned later in the afternoon our room was ready, and located in the back of the hotel, which ment 2 lifts (elevators) but no big deal, the room was clean and huge, free wi-fi and bar fridge big enough for us to store our own drinks in. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet, I thought we might have been the only people on the floor. Breakfast is included and is the standard buffet, but does include a pancake maker that shoots out a cooked pancake in 45 seconds or thereabouts. There is a small business centre on the same level as the pool and breakfast room. Overall I thought this was one of the best places we stayed in the US, we were offered late checkout but only til 1400 as they were fully booked and would need our room, but again storing our bags was no problem, and a car was arranged for us to get to the airport. The big question I ask myself after staying anywhere is - would I stay here again - and for HIE Hollywood Walk of Fame - the answer would have to be yes, without a second thought. Overall great people, location and services.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Debra B
Reviews.Content: ...experience at this hotel. Bailey, the front desk clerk, couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. The hotel is beautiful and ultra clean. It even smells good! Very close to the Hollywood Bowl--walking distance--and wonderful to come home after the show and go straight to bed!! Great hotel--I will definitely be back. Debby

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: terri3089
Reviews.Content: I love the standard of Holiday Inns, why they are my first choice when looking for a hotel. This one was as good, if not better than my expectations! The room was spacious and clean, the bed was big and comfy! The breakfast was tasty and filling, nice pancakes and scrambled eggs! The location was perfect as I didn't have a car, was a 5 minute walk to Hollywood BLVD, the area was ok to walk through at night. Very secure hotel, after 11pm they have a security guy checking keycards, that made me feel safe. The whole hotel was clean, staff friendly and helpful, overall very good and would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy39571
Reviews.Content: This HI is in a perfect location for seeing Hollywood--an easy walking distance to all the sites. We could even see the HOLLYWOOD sign from our eighth-floor window. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in time and were given a room right away. The only drawback is that itâ€™s built on the side of a hill and you have to take two elevators to reach the top floors, but you can request a lower room. The breakfast is undoubtedly the best and most ample free one weâ€™ve ever had. Every staff member we spoke with was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed and pillows, big bathroom, work area, hide-a-bed, and table and chairs. Everythingâ€”plumbing, Internet, elevatorsâ€”worked properly, and we had no issues with noise. The entire hotel (lobby, elevators, business center, breakfast room, fitness room, pool, parking lot) was clean and odor-free, and we felt very safe. Check-out was fast and processed correctly. You can find cheaper rooms in the area, but I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stays and Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: CK82
Reviews.Content: After some research we flew from Las Vegas to LA and chose to fly to Burbank on a Saturday morning. The hotel was a 15 minute taxi ride away from the airport approx $35. We arrived early and although the room wasnâ€™t ready reception staff were welcoming and happy to check us in. The hotel is located less than 10 minutes walk from the Kodak theatre and the Hollywood walk of fame. There were plenty of restaurants and shops in this area including a Hard Rock and it was easy to entertain ourselves for a couple of hours. On our return we checked out the hotel quickly and found the pool which was in the centre of the building a couple of floors up. We were given a note with login details on for the free wifi and also told we could use the business centre free of charge, this included printing of boarding passes. We usually stay at much more expensive hotels where you would pay for this service. Our room was darker than pictures portray but perfectly acceptable. Bedlinens were a good standard and the bathroom clean, amenities included shampoo and separate conditioner which was good. The air conditioning was a unit built into the front of the building and although a bit noisy it was efficient. Our room faced the main road and on a Saturday night /Sunday morning the noise from traffic was minimal despite thousands of people leaving the Bowl. Our main reason for choosing the hotel was its proximity to the Hollywood Bowl. Reviews had told us it was at most a 15 min walk and they were correct. I had a hip replacement last year and in the middle of a heatwave and up a slight hill we still managed without any problems. Breakfast next morning was better than other Holiday Inn expresses we have been to. The room had a bright feel to it. Coffee and orange juice of low quality were available along with cinnamon rolls, bagels, cream cheese and there was also a pancake making machine. The lady helping there went out of her way to be curteous and helpful when the machine needed replenishing and kept the serving areas tidy. Overall this is a basic hotel which works very hard to be the best it can be. For the price we paid and the location we were happy with our choice as a short term stay and would be happy to come back again for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks every Box , Will go back !!”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group of seven including two small children (5 & 3) We generally stay at fancy 5 star hotels but on this holiday decided to be a little more realistic with the kids etc. This is one hotel I would definately go back to. We originally booked Crowne Plaza,Beverley Hills. We are so glad we changed. Holiday Inn was walking distance to the blvd and main hollywood attractions including where all the tours leave from.we spent most of our time in Hollywood. From here we also cabbed it to sunset,santa monica and beverley hills for reasonable fares. santa Monica being the furthest (just over half hour). The rooms were clean and updated,Friendly service,no road noise and we felt very safe. I would have to say the highlight here was the daily breakfasts. While the breakfast room was a little crammed at times you just needed to pick your times. We were early starters so worked fine for us. There was an excellent range of food to suit all appetites. at the end of the day there was also the pleasant outdoor pool to cool off if needed !!! Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: jenny o
Reviews.Content: It is what you expect from holiday inn.The room was big enough for all 5 of us breakfast was good continental as stated.Area was busy but very accessable with hire car.Parking available under hotel at extra cost but worth it...The lifts were small, breakfast room tiny with not enough seating.However pool was great for splashing around in kids loved it after busy day.Staff were very helpful it did not help that they were laying fresh carpet in hall way at night but it had to be done at some point.As stated easy to walk to attraction of the walk of fame there were quite a few tramps lying around in the area but we still walked at night with the children for something to eat so you just have to be a little wary.It was a good base for us to visit LA and somewhere to crash.The toilet was a little on the small size but you just have to get on with it.... I would book again if needed in the future. We had a small kitchen area but never used it as we were out and about for meals it seemed ok.

Reviews.Title: “Crummy hotel in a good location. My room was under the gym, so I could hear the treadmills all night until it closed.. about 9-1”
Reviews.Author: Sawdoff
Reviews.Content: See above.. I wrote my comments in the wrong box, but hopefully u still get my remarks..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: bk_ny_family
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late August on the first leg of our family's SoCal vacation. Here's the rundown: Pros: - Great location - 5 min drive to Universal Studios, very short walk to Hollywood Bowl, Hollywood Blvd (Walk of Fame, Grumans, Mme Tussauds), Sunset, Vine). - Well Maintained property - rooms in excellent condition - ultra clean. The hotel smelled great throughout the property. The housekeeping staff should be recognized for their efforts. - Breakfast - comes with the room reservation. Standard breakfast fare - nothing gourmet or outstanding, but it is included, filling - does the job for starting off the day. Tables limited around 9am. - Outdoor Pool - A bit small, but nice to have it around to take a quick dip in. Our kids had a great time enjoying it. - Amazingly fast Check-in / Check Out process Cons: - Most amenities (laundry, pool, etc) not available for use after 8pm. The hours should extend to 10 or 11pm. - The Guest Laundry Room is not sufficient - there is only 1 set of machines for the entire hotel. I wasted up to 3 hours of my vacation time waiting for the machines to be available. Also, I had to purchase our laundry supplies - at other hotels, the laundry supplies are complimentary. The dryer took forever to dry clothes which exacerbated the wait time. - The complimentary WiFi / Internet was way too slow. Another hotel guest echoed my frustration with the performance in the business center, also my husband didn't bother using his laptop since the WiFi was so slow. - The front desk staff didn't not mention any further benefits that we could be eligible for since we are Priority Rewards members. We could have used the extended checkout. Also, the front desk didn't seem interested that we were staying and didn't suggest any dining or touring/attractions to visit. I usually get recommendations from the front desk when they ask if we were there for a leisure trip. Also, it would help if the parking was free for hotel guests. - It was also very difficult by car to enter and exit the hotel on highland avenue. There should be a way for guests to be able to enter the hotel directly instead of turning up side roads to get in. This was very stressful and unnerving during our stay. Although I listed the cons above, I would definitely stay again the next time we visit L.A. It would be great if management focuses on these items - I would've rated the hotel a 5 instead of a 4, if not for these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from the Walk of Fame and the Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we had limited time to do "touristy" stuff - it was a good call. The room was nice, big and clean. Breakfast was adequate (typical free breakfast stuff). Unfortunately, parking was $22/day, but I guess that's to be expected in the heart of most major cities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay close to Hollywood Blvd attractions”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a double queen. Everything was spotless, the staff pleasant and the swimming-pool a definite plus for the kids. The hotel has valet parking, which cost us approx $20 a night, but it was good for peace of mind. The free breakfast was just fine, though a bit crowded at 8:30 to 9:30 am, as can be expected. Try to get one of the tables outside the breakfast room, beside the pool, much more relaxing. The only issue we had was that there was no hot water in our shower both mornings. I mentioned it at the front desk, and maintenance came to fix it in our absence, apparently, but I think the problem was just due to too much demand at a time everybody is getting up. (I tried the shower when we got back from eating out on the first evening and it was perfectly hot at that time of night). To summarize, this is a comfortable, clean hotel in a strategic position. It is more expensive than your average HIE precisely for that reason. Maybe management should put some of that extra cash into installing a new hot water boiler to cope with the number of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with an excellent location..just a few flaws!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_sunshine14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Holiday Inn during our week stay in Hollywood in August. We thought the hotel was furnished to a high standard. We are from England and consider the Holiday Inn to be of a similar standard to a Premier Inn. Check in was simple and we were happy with our room. The room was of a very good size with two double beds and a nice big bathroom. We hired a car during our stay and the valet parking was good. The car was always collected very quickly. However, we think the price of parking the car was quite expensive, but I suppose it is Hollywood! The location of The Holiday Inn was perfect. It was right in the heart of Hollywood with just a short walk from The Hollywood Walk of Fame. During our stay we travelled to Disneyland, Universal, Warner Brothers, the beaches, Griffith Park, Dodgers baseball etc. and The Holiday Inn is ideally located for all these places, with good access to the freeway. We felt safe at this hotel and one night when we came home late, felt reassured to see a guy in reception who just guarded the hotel. Breakfast was adequate. There was a good choice of cereal, pastries, cooked food and pancakes to cater for all tastes. However, the room breakfast is served in doesnâ€™t cater for the sheer volume of guests. Unless you get to breakfast ridiculously early, or late, you are often left waiting for a table to be free. The room was constantly crowded and made for breakfast to be quite stressful. It was nice to have a pool at this hotel, although as it was in the middle of the hotel building, there was a lot of shade and it was difficult to lie in the sun. Every time we went out there, usually late afternoon, people were lying on the loungers in the sun, so we were stuck in the shade. Still, you donâ€™t really come to Hollywood to sunbathe. Towards the middle of our stay we had a problem with ants in the room. We suddenly saw lots of ants walking from near the window down towards the table. We mentioned this at reception and the person behind the desk was very apologetic and said there would be someone up that day to solve the problem. The volume of ants had decreased but there were still ants by the end of our stay. Some had even made their way to the bathroom and bedside cabinets. Not nice! However, donâ€™t let this put you off as I am sure this is a one off as other people havenâ€™t mentioned it in reviews. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and if we ever returned to Hollywood, we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: sford87
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had stayed at this hotel. We went the first time in Feb 2010 and liked it so much that we knew for sure that is where we wanted to stay when we went back. It's only a short walk to Hollywood Blvd. and Hollywood and Highland Center. The complementary breakfast was awesome and saved us a lot of money. The staff (front desk and valet) were both really friendly and helpful. Both times I've been it was just me and another female friend but we always felt perfectly safe in our location. I'll always stay at this hotel when I visit Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert154
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. This would give the Beverely Hills Hotel a run for its money. Very clean, exceptional staff, polite, efficient, and helpful. Rooms were immaculate Free breakfast (you guys rule !!!!). The maid service was superb. Could not find fault anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking blocks of Hollywood Walk of Fame!”
Reviews.Author: Comesanas
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed this hotel! Very close to the Hollywood Walk of Fame and all of the different tours! Our room was froom was very accommodating for a family of four, large and very comfortable. We made use of the hotel's washing machine and dryer as well as the pool. The breakfast room was large with flat screen TV's,next to the pool and the breakfast was very good. I chose this hotel based upon other Trip Advisor reviews and would like to pass it along to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: Kjd773
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a 3 minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard & Mann's Chinese Theatre & the Walk of Fame. Close to shopping & restaurants. Valet service was excellent. All the staff we encountered were very friendly & helpful. Breakfast buffet was certainly adequate. The king size bed was better than mine at home! Location is a bit noisy if staying at the front of the hotel as we did but nothing to complain about. I slept like a baby. We had an executive king suite which was very spacious & clean as was the whole property. Our room had a window that opened which was nice to let some fresh air in. Would definitely recommend for the price & location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would return if in area”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloAmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, Aug 5th-7th, while in town to see Hairspray at the Hollywood Bowl. It was a very nice hotel, in a great location for walking to the Hollywood Bowl and other nearby attractions, ie Walk of Fame, Hollywood and Highland etc... The room wasn't ready upon checkin, but was a few hours later, it was a very nice two queen bed room, room 504. The rate wasn't bad, as I had the AAA rate. The room was very clean with standard amenities, it also had a nice flat screen TV, comfortable chair for sitting, and a nice work area desk. The one room downfall was the wireless internet, though free, the connection was extremely slow and horrible. The desk clerk said it was because of everyone getting on it, I don't think everyone in all the rooms was getting on at exactly the same time. The hotel has a very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast was very good, with a great variety of food, pancakes, sausage, bacon, cereal, danishes, coffee, juice, milk, better than most free breakfasts at similar hotels. I can't comment on the fitness center, or pool, as I didn't use either. I did walk out by the pool and it looked like a calm area, and was clean. The business center is free to use, and the internet is wired and way better than what's in the rooms. There's also a small store next to the front desk, that sells drinks, candy bars, chips etc... and also has a microwave for guest use. Like I said, the area is good for walking to many nearby attractions. I highly recommend seeing a show at the Hollywood Bowl, as it's an amazing venue---but bring your own food and drink in, and don't park there! It's a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There's some restaurants close by, and others within walking distance up and around Hollywood Blvd. I did notice one thing about the hotel, if you're on floors 6-8, you have to take two elevators to get to your room. You go to the 5th floor from the lobby, then from there take a second elevator. It seems a little inconvenient if you're staying on one of those floors. Overly, it was a nice hotel, and I'd gladly return if I was in the area again. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: jeff-from-hamilton
Reviews.Content: This was an above average hotel (friendly staff, very clean, very quick valet service) but what made it great was the price, which for Hollywood was very reasonable, and the location - just 1 block from Hollywood Blvd. We were also only a 5-10 minute drive to Universal Studios and within walking distance of Hollywood Bowl. Overall, couldn't ask for a better location. The breakfast was only average and the pool is very small, but if going back to Hollywood, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A "Gem" in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MIKE R
Reviews.Content: What a Blessing this Hotel was. Bailey and all the rest of the Staff were excellent in customer service, area knowldge and all smiled while they did their jobs. The Hotel is just a 1.5 blocks from Hollywood and Highland which is right in the middle of the Walk of Fame. After fighting traffic all day to get there we were so glad to pull in and escape the Hollywood/LA scene. Rooms are oversized and quite. Breakfast is served on 4th floor so you don't have all the Lobby business and bustle going on around you. Brekafast was more than just your typical HIE cinnamon rolls and eggs. The Ladies upstairs took care of the food like they were serving their family a Holiday meal. I want to go back to LA just to stay at this Hotel and maybe take a Studio Tour, which we did not do this trip. 20.00 Dollar a day for parking sounded steep but was worth it for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend and would go again”
Reviews.Author: xangelfacex
Reviews.Content: The check in process was easy and quick and the staff were great! The room was quite big and excellently priced, we stayed there for 2 weeks and had no issues at all. The free buffet breakfast was such a bonus and the food is quite decent- you end up saving quite a bit of money by having breakfast provided by the hotel, not to mention time too! At night, there is a security guy who sat in front of the elevator, which makes you feel a lot safer too! The staff at the hotel were excellent for example when we wanted to go to Disneyland and stay for fireworks, but no tours would stay that late, We asked the staff at reception and they arranged for a private car to take us there and pick us up. The driver- i don't remember his name (I think it was Daniel) was really great!! He was on time to pick us up from both the hotel and disneyland and didn't complain at all, even when he had to come at 1am to pick us up from Disneyland. Similarly, because we had 5 people in our group, the people at reception recommended a private driver to get to the airport, which was a faster way to get to the airport and cheaper too, because the shuttle's charged per head. Only issue was at the end when we were checking out, there was a charge against our room for parking but because the lady at reception remembered us and knew that we used various methods of transport e.g. public and shuttles, she removed the charge immediately!! The hotel is an absolutely fabulous place to stay and location wise is extremely convenient and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & very neat”
Reviews.Author: Agemel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights in a room with a queen and pull out couch. The room was neat and very comfortable for the three of us (adults). It is located a short walk from the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the underground train system. We found the service to be adequate and generally helpful. The breakfast selection was fantastic however it was generally so packed out that you would have to take food back to your room or wait. There is a convenience store across the road and is only a short walk to the Highland shopping precinct and other shops. Our room looked out to the road which you would normally expect to be very noisy. Once the curtains were drawn it wasn't so bad. The hotel has a laundry if you need to do your own washing which came in handy for us. A great stay at a nicely located and clean hotel. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jadersk8er
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice part of Los Angeles. We had a room with two queen beds and a basic bathroom with a view of the street and partly the Kodak Theater. The pool was supposed to be 86 degrees fahrenheit, but felt more like 65. The breakfast was like any other Holiday Inn Expresses(eggs, coffee, bagels, etc.). If I could recommend anywhere for lunch or dinner, I'd say the Hollywood Mongolian Bowl at The Grove by the Kodak Theater, or a Johnny Rockets also at The Grove. The Hollywood Mongolian Bowl is where you get rice and vegetables at a little bar, then they fry it on a big stove for you. It's good food. I'd recommend this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBs
Reviews.Content: No complaints on this place; stayed with 2 young teens our our room with plenty of space; Starbucks, Subway and market just across the street and within a safe, 5-minute walk to the Walk of Fame area! Skip the free breakfast as you get what you pay for; instead grab a breakfast sandwich at Subway or Starbucks for a quick breakfast, or walk to Mel's Diner. You won't need a rental car as public transportation is just down the corner. And plan on a show at the Hollywood Bowl; you can walk there in 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: CCMark
Reviews.Content: Great Holiday Inn just a few blocks north of Hollywood Blvd. Easy walk to all the attractions. Enjoyed a very courteous staff and a nice two bed suite. Note that the suite is one large room with a nice sitting area. Hotel had a nice pool and good size breakfast area. The pool is surrounded by rooms on an upper floor so you don't need to deal with the wind and elements. There is a full grocery market and a Subway right across the street. Keep in mind this is Hollywood so the market is higher priced than normal. Overall, we definitely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great LA option”
Reviews.Author: k17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and modern, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic - within view of the Hollywood & highland shopping complex and associated restaurants, and a short walk to the Chinese theatre etc. The area feels very safe. The subway located at the H&H centre takes you to Universal studios in one stop, and makes a large amount of the rest of LA very accessable (for example, we caught the subway to Dodger stadium for a night time game, no problems). There are also numerous buses from the H&H centre, we caught one directly to the Grove shopping mall and a quick change of buses took us directly to Santa Monica. A very good option for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Marty5136fair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing close to Hollywood and Highland, the main intersection of Hollywood. We took the Fly Away bus from the airport to Union Station for $7 each and then rode the Metro to the H0llywood and HIghland stop for $1.50 each, which is a total of $8.50 for transportation. The cab ride from LAX to the hotel is $100, so pack light (They have washers and dryers at the hotel.) and take public transportation. You'll save a bundle. There is a grocery store across the street from the hotel and a liquor store, too. Hollywood Bowl is only three blocks north, so you can easily walk there. Our room was quiet and as described on the hotel web site. We had a king suite with a sofa hide-a-bed. Both the king bed and hide-a-bed were very comfortable, although we did have to put the sheets on the hide-a-bed to use it. Breakfast had lots of choices and Marieta, the hostess, did an outstanding job keeping all the food and drink items restocked and the tables wiped off. (The earlier you go, the easier it is to navigate the food line and to find a table. The later you do, the crazier it is. Between 9 and 9:30, when the breakfast area closes, it is extremely crowded and very difficult to find an empty table, especiially on the weekend.) The exercise room is adaquate as there are two treadmills, which run quite loudly and an exercise ball. There are no free weights. The swimming pool is not heated, but it is a clean and neat area. Jessica, the day desk staff and Alfonso, the night desk staff, are extremely helpful. Both of them are eager to make your stay very enjoyable memorable. Stay here. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blondemummy
Reviews.Content: After spending many hours reading through reviews for a hotel in Hollywood, we were happy with our final choice here. We arrived early and was told there was no rooms available but after waiting 5 minutes, we were sent to one that was ready. The 4pm check in is a bit late as people were arriving many times between 1-3 and being told to come back later for a room. The room itself was spacious and the kitchenette was handy. I would suggest placing some cutlery in a drawer as we didn't have any with us but had a toddler who wanted his heated up food 'now'. The location is great. A few minutes walk to be in the thick of it but nice at the end of the day to come back to a little bit of 'quiet'. The breakfast was the best that we had in a hotel in our trip and the pool was great to relax by. We had no transport and got around fine with the hop on, hop off bus and the Super Shuttle and Exec Shuttle were great for airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SteveHD
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening and found the hotel very easily driving from LAX. If you're looking for somewhere central in Hollywood, within easy reach of the sights this is the place to be. It's in easy walking distance from the Hollywood Bowl, the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Auditorium where the Oscars Ceremony is held. The rooms are excellent, far above what you would expect for the price. The small breakfast room has everything you need to get you started on your day. Parking is in the hotel's own car park which makes it really convenient when you want to go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: GaryN4
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here as first time absolute tourists to LA and Hollywood - and this fitted the bill. We were so busy using all our time for shopping and sightseeing this was the perfect location for our short LA trip particularly as its a 5 minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard and the range of tour offices, theatres, restaurants and attractions. Universal Studios is 5 minutes drive away, there's a convenient mini-mart across the road and if you're driving - there's carparking. Its definitely no 'lounge-around' resort - but like most Holiday Inn Express set-ups the standard is clean and reliable. Staff were helpful and polite and ably assisted us with directions, tours and other local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: McSwain
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles is BIG! So you have to decide where to stay. We chose to stay at Holiday Inn Express for 5 days, to see everything in Hollywood. The location is perfect, only a few minutes walk from Hollywood Walk of Fame and quite a few museums and attractions. It is very close to several departure points for sightseeing tours, and some of them even pick you up at the hotel. Hotel was clean, with large rooms, a nice swimming pool and a decent breakfast. The Breakfast rooom gets crowded, som remember to get up early, in order to grab a table. there are a few tables outside as well, beside the pool. The staff was great, from the valet guys to the girls at the front desk. I only have two complaints: The wi-fi was awful, although some of the other guests said that it worked well for them. We had lots of problems with it. Frustrating.. And the fitness room was a joke, They have threadmills, but no weights, and no AC in the fitness rooom. Since there was a heatwave, it was the same as working out in a sauna.... That said, I would definintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to their high reviews!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverKiwi76
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at the Holiday Inn in Hollywood, because I had read their great reviews, and I have to say they lived up to it! The hotel is in very clean and smart condition, the check in was fast, and they were polite and friendly. The room was very clean and large, with 2 queen beds, and I thought it was great value for money ($220/night including tax). This also included breakfast, (which was not amazing, but enough to get you started for the day). The location of the hotel within Hollywood is great, it's less than 5 mins walk from the corner of Hollywood and Highland which is the major intersection there. But the overall location of Hollywood is perhaps not the best place to stay in LA. That cannot be held against the hotel at all, thats just personal choice about which area to stay in! The only complaints I could come up with were a) they had no maps of the area and b) breakfast was mediocre (but as above sufficient to get you started). Well done Holiday Inn, I would recommend this hotel to friends if they were choosing to stay in this area. LA Tip: Take the LAX Flyer and subway from the airport to Hollywood (and this hotel) rather than paying for expensive cabs or time consuming shuttles. It took me the same amount of time to do this, as to take the Prime Time Shuttle, what a waste of time and money the Prime Time shuttle was!

Reviews.Title: “Such a sweet suite!”
Reviews.Author: islandb8by
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in a suite for one night while in Hollywood. It was great. Big, spacious, plenty of room. Of course, one bathroom, but who cares! When doubling up in the beds, we all had some sort of mattress to sleep on (2 king beds and a sleeper sofa). They get knocked down a star because of the ridiculous $22 per day parking fee. That's my only complaint. Otherwise, I'd definitely stay here again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Kywi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a good place to stay. Great location. Walk to many attractions and restaurants. If you are driving it is difficult to get out of the hotel because of traffic. The parking should be free but the valets are very helpful and quick. All of the staff were excellent. The breakfast was good but certainly nothing fancy. The double queen room was very large, clean and comfortable. Make sure you see a concert at the Hollywood Bowl. Take a picnic there before the show. Best part of our trip. Note that because of the breakfast buffet there will be mostly families at the hotel and the breakfast room is packed. Get there early. They do keep it stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Family Visit”
Reviews.Author: bakeralvin
Reviews.Content: Great location. Suites are excellent for a family. Friendly staff. Close to sites, hollywood bowl.... highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “First class location. Very well worth your money. Not inspiring interiours.”
Reviews.Author: Karesson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. Valet Parking works really well and is cheap. Breakfast is ok with a good selection (according to the facts it's included in the price and by US standards). The rooms are very large, and so are the toilets. The look is very 80-ish. Not worn out or in bad condition. Just dated and not very interesting. We booked a room with 2 separate beds, but eventhough we kept insisting at frontdesk to give us one. We didn't get it over 4 nights stay... Really BAD. And if you're depending on internet... Bring your own. Worst Wifi ever - even to US std. it was no good. Didn't work at all in the rooms (asked several other guests eventhough frontdesk said there was no problem...). It only works on 4th floor by the business center. Pool area small but nice! Great beds. I'd recommend this to anyone visiting LA for Hollywood blvd, Melrose, Sunset strip - and Universal studios. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic sized rooms!! Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelBug6753
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We enjoyed our stay. The size of the room was fantastic for the price we paid, compared to some box sized rooms i have stayed in. The bathroom was also a decent size. It was also in a great location, about a 5-10 min walk to Hollywood, where all the action happens. We also had free breakfast included and free wifi which was a great plus, since other hotels rip you off for wifi. Definitley stay here in LA, ut's great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Yaiki
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in LA so we knew we had to be near the main attractions. Everythng is near this area: Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, chinese Theatre... just a couple of minutes away, but the best thing was the underground station! That metro line connected us with the rest of the places that were a little bit far: downtown, el Pueblo, Union Station (with wonderful quick and cheap connection to LAX), universal Studios... we didn't need a car at all. Moreover there was a supermarket rightin front of the hotel. People we really nice, solving all our doubts and giving us all the information we needed. Rooms really spacious, clean, nice confortable beds and wi-fi and breakfast included! Still think it could be a little bit cheaper but i wouldn't hesitate to go back to this same hotel next time we go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: PlusTax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a room with 2 queen beds with our 14 yo son. The room is a good size with comfortable beds and quiet at night - no problems sleeping. The breakfast is very good and is a great bonus. You are aonly 5 minutes drive or taxi from Universal studios and a sport walk from Hollywood boulivard. Both being the key attractions in the area. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: guffergriff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a return from our Hawaiian honeymoon. We had heard many negative reports about LA and had low expectations. I have to say that we both loved our stay here. This hotel is very well located. The service by the receptionist Mickey was truly 5 out of 5. We were upgraded to a king room, the hotel is clean and the beds are comfy. The pool area is small but cute. The walk of fame is just a short walk away and you can see the Hollywood sign if you look up to the left as you leave the hotel. If I return to LA, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Willie_Talk
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed here. Very friendly staff, clean rooms & nice atmosphere. The breakfast buffet was excellent. My only complaint would be the $20 per day parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great position 2 blocks from Hollywood Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: Paws20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great position. Two blocks from Hollywood Boulevard and shopping centre. Across the road was a few stores Subway, pizza shop and a convenience store. The rooms are clean and comfortable except my son slept on the sofa bed which need a new mattress desperately. The airconditioning unit was a quite loud when running (which we found this in every hotel was stayed in while in America). The breakfast was great, a wide variety of choice, loved the pancake maker. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from Hollywood Blvd but not close to the rest of the tourist area in LA. The hotel is clean, basic, no restaurant/bar, no big lobby, attentive service, the room is spacious, beds are comfortable, restroom is ok. Overall it's good value for your money specially in that area of LA where hotels are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourist and family”
Reviews.Author: mjlent
Reviews.Content: Place was perfect for family travel. Short walk to the Hollywood sites: Walk of Fame, Madame Tussauds, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, etc. and you can sit with George Clooney in the lobby. Felt safe and secure. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good size, reasonable spot.”
Reviews.Author: nzcoops
Reviews.Content: Very close to Hollywood, ~3 minute walk. You have to walk past a dodgy corner which at night has some characters on it but there's always lots of people around. Room was large, bed comfy, good wifi and good breakfast included, continental and cooked. Good TV and air con. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- I recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: wazoo-okc
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, competent and professional. Service was very good. Good breakfast is included. Location was perfect. Very pleasant stay. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WonderWilma
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend if you want to stay in Hollywood. Nice breakfast, clean rooms and free wifi. Very close to Hollywood Boulevard and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: shopgirI
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. Clean rooms, complimentary in room WIFI (though it does not work). Nice breakfast but be sure to get down to the the breakfast room early as it can get quite busy and full. Their breakfast dining place is not big. Can't really fault this hotel except that if you are arriving from the airport by the metro, it is about a 10-15 mins walk dragging your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable! Walking distance to Hollywood Blvd - convenient to restaurants & sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: BGGast
Reviews.Content: Wonderful breakfast and convenient guest laundry room. Avoided traffic jams and parking problems by using Metro, bus & tours for most transportation (no rental.) LA Info center close by for info on Metro, bus and major attractions. Excellent trip!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: lmfreeman
Reviews.Content: the comped breakfast was excellent. Restaurant staff were especially good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Normally when in this area I stay at the Renaissance Hollywood but it was sold out on my last trip. There was a Priority Club promotion on so I thought I would give this hotel a try and I'm very glad I did. I was on one of the higher floors and the room was huge! The only downside of this is that you have to take two elevators. The first to the 5th floor (I think) and then you walk to the back of the hotel around the pool atrium to the elevator that serves the upper floors. This really wasn't much of an issue but its good to know when checking in as it might be an problem for some. The bed was great and had a duvet vs a bedspread which thankfully most hotels are getting rid of. The AC, Internet and TV all worked well. The bathroom was spotless and there were lots of really good towels. Because I was at the back of the hotel it was extremely quiet. The hotel was full but I hardly saw anyone. This hotel is within easy walking distance of Hollywood Blvd and the sites and restaurants. It's about a 5 minute walk to the Kodak Theatre, Mann's etc.There is a small strip mall across the street for snacks. This will be my new first choice hotel when staying in this area. Not as fancy as the Renaissance, but it is much cheaper and MUCH quieter.

Reviews.Title: “A favourite spot in LA”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the HIE during May. One thing I like about this hotel is the consistenly high level of service. The staff, from the minute you arrive to the time you leave are extremely competent, friendly and helpful. It would be unfair to pick one staff member as exemplary; they all are !! Both times I had a huge suite, with its own mini kitchen/lounge area, which was great for preparing your own food. Good coffee/tea maker and nice toileteries in the bathroom. WIFI was free and fast, even on the 5th floor. Only problem was the second visit, the plasma TV was permanently on black & white, but that was a small inconvemience. I love this hotel, location is perfect, rooms lovely and again the best staff a hotel could wish for !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: steve4747_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the first part of our honeymoon to the US and we selected this hotel as a result of the tripadvisor reviews and the location, we were not disappointed. We took a taxi from LAX airport which cost $50. The hotel is just a short walk from the Hollywood walk of fame area and the Kodak Theatre, we also used it as a base to visit universal studios which was less than 10 minutes aways by taxi. We stayed in a suite which was an excellent size and very clean, the air conitioning was good but a little on the noisy side as it was a standalone type unit under the window, however we got used to this. The breakfast provided by the hotel is not an extensive selection but is perfectly adequate providing a wide selection of cereals and pastries as well as bacon and eggs. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good location at a reasonable cost in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: papay50
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted to redeem some reward points and I have to admit I was very reluctant to stay here. The last time we stayed in one was back in 1995 and since then we've avoided the chain. This time, we decided to try it again and I was pleasantly surprised at the vast improvement from the last time. We went to L.A. for a quick Hollywood look-around during Memorial Day weekend and since we weren't looking for a hotel with a view, this place was more than adequate for our needs. We booked two rooms, one for my husband and I and the other for three teen-age boys. The breakfast that was included in the rooms was heaven-sent, you all know how much "growing boys" can eat. The staff were all very approachable and helpful, especially Armando at the front desk and Marietta at the breakfast room. The rooms were very clean and the free wi-fi was another plus. I don't know why the four and five-star hotels still charges for internet service. I did like the location of the hotel - far enough from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood and Vine but also just a very short walk from everything. Universal Studios is just a five-minute drive. So, if you want a no-frills but comfortable and convenient hotel, the Holiday Inn Express and Suites in Hollywood is very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Mim2510
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect for me as I was travelling alone. Great price, clean, quiet( apart from air con), friendly staff, nice breakfast & great location. I would stay again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first visit to L.A.”
Reviews.Author: bencat123
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is in an amazing location for first time visitors. A short 5 min walk to hollywood boulevard and the tourist mecca that is Hollywood. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly the rooms spotless and a nice pool to finish the day. The breakfast was the usual holiday inn/ staybridge suites fare but adequate. Convenient store and food oulets just across the road. We checked out the Japanese restaurant across the road and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Hollywood Boulevard and Bowl”
Reviews.Author: Hazeyjean
Reviews.Content: Small 5 storey hotel on a busy main road. Secure valet parking and efficient reception staff. Pleasant room, clean and comfortable and free wifi, no views. Nice complimentary breakfast, although a bit of a "free for all" atmosphere. Nice swimming pool on 4th floor and small gym. We found this hotel a good location for walking to Hollywood Boulevard and hotel organised citytour for us with pickup at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: Great place to start your LA vacation. Walking distance to walk of fame and many tours in the area. Breakfast was simple and the staff was first rate. We walked to everything including the bus stop and train.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Grace082
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, clean and courteous staff at the valet parking as well as the front desk. Good location, close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, average service, clean, too close to the street”
Reviews.Author: juliancho79
Reviews.Content: The location is the best feature of this hotel. It is very clean and comfortable but all suites are facing the street and they are noisy for this reason. There was a lady who provided very poor service but then there was a boy who made it up the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location If Without a Car”
Reviews.Author: Abbeydoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for anyone who is visiting LA without a car or just wants to leave the car in the parking lot and use public transport. The metro is 5-10 minutes walk away as is the Highland Centre, Walk of Fame, Chinese & Kodak Theatres. The hotel rooms were a good size and more than suitable for a family of three. The beds are extremely comfortable and there is a flat screen TV with numerous channels. Wifi is available in the public areas, as are two PC's with one attached to a printer. Breakfast is adequate with fruit, cereals, yoghurt's, bacon, eggs, sausages and coffee. The breakfast set us up well for the day. There is a small outside pool but we did not use this. Service was good and the staff were very helpful in letting us have a late check out room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: roseWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days 4 nights at this excellent hotel the staff could not do enough for you and the lady that was in the breakfast room every morning (Marieta) was a pure delight and very efficient,very reasonable priced our executive suite was heaven to come back to after long days sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “This can never be rated an 8 on my list!”
Reviews.Author: Rnplus2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was rated an eight for location, the rooms and service.This is an #8 for the whole Los Angeles. Taught me that I can't really trust trip advisor reviewers either. It's a run down hotel and a little bit better than Day's Inn. The location isn't so great by the way. It's still about 2 blocks from hollywood blvd. So when you're with toddlers and the hot sun behind your back, that's not easy. I also got a 2 bed executive suite with kitchenette. OMG! the kitchenette was a cabinet. At least in the picture they showed on the site, there was a counter with 3-4 cabinets. Well ours was just 1 cabinet, so just enough for the tiny sink...more like a bar sink and no other place to put your stuff. by the way the 2 bed executive suite is just a room with 2 beds and a sofa bed. no walls separating the beds from the sofabed and kitchenette. Their free wi-fi also didn't work. That's the caution when they say free. We're on a road trip all around California so we've got BUGGAGE for 5. There's no bell service when we checked out. I had to bring the cart myself up to the room... lift and put the luggages on the cart, roll the cart to the elevator and bring it to our car. Not so great for an 8.

Reviews.Title: “Seems I got the short straw”
Reviews.Author: yasushicho
Reviews.Content: Felt I had to write a review on this hotel as the room we were given was so different to any images I have seen on the hotel website and Tripadvisor members photos. It was small, half the size of the any images I have seen. Had one tiny window at the top of the wall that looked out to a brick wall under some stairs. Unsurprisingly therefore the room was very dark. The television was old and when you turned it on was automatically on volume 99 out of 100 everytime, the signal was also pretty poor. The fridge was so loud I had to take the plug out of it, not that it was problem as there was nothing in it anyway! Luckily though the room was fairly clean, it all seemed a bit old and outdated though. The keys to the room had not been activated after we had checked in so we had to go back down to reception from the sixth floor, which takes a while in itself as you have to take one lift then walk through the corridors round to the other side of the hotel and get another lift down. In the morning we asked reception to book us a taxi, they asked if we wanted a yellow taxi or a limo service, we replied a yellow taxi presuming that was the normal LA taxi. Then a Black 4x4 pulled up and the Valet said this was our taxi, we questioned them saying we had asked for a yellow taxi and they replied yes this is it, so having only been in LA a few hours we took what they said and got in. As we thought it turned out to be a Limo service and cost us $25 where the same journey on the way back cost us $13. The driver also explained to us that he was in partnership with the hotel. What a coincidence... All in all a pretty awful stay at a hotel I was thinking would have been one of the safest options of knowing what you were going to get in Hollywood. After looking at other peoples reviews and photos on tripadvisor we seemed to get half the room everyone else got which would have been fine if it was half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jegan_T
Reviews.Content: we were there in mid april 2011. We took a blue shuttle taxi from LAX which was a big mistake, the journey was incredible long (1H 20min) as the passengers would be dropped off at the doorstep (good for late night travelers i guess). The hotel was situated about a 5min walk from the walk of fame, kodak theater ect, so the location was great. Universal studio is close by too. There is a metro just at the walk to access downtown LA. Santa Monica and Venice beach is quite a drive away though. The hotel staff advised us against taking public transportation to the beach as the journey wld hv been to long. We were fortunate to have a friend with a caravan who took us around which made the trip really memorable. Morning breakfast was provided inclusive of the room charges. It was good but there were not many varieties. There is a Subway sandwich place just across the road (24H) which was very useful after late nights. The staff was very very helpful which was great! there was internet for free which we treasured as we could manage work and skype home anytime. The room was comfortable and clean. We had a great time and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Allie060
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our road trip through California and we all wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel offers outstanding value for money. The location's perfect for seeing the sights of Hollywood being just a short walk from the Walk of Fame and restaurants, yet it's a little off the main drag so is nice and quiet. This is probably the best Holiday Inn we stayed in. There was a nice pool, the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was modern and immaculately clean. Free wifi access was nice and our kids loved the choice of TV stations! Breakfast offers a good choice of cooked and continental. When I compare this to a 5 star hotel we stayed in at about three times the price, in terms of value for money, there is no comparison. If anything the Holiday Inn front desk staff were more helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: Upon first site of this hotel, our first stop on our trip into the US from Australia, the hotel and it's surrounds looked a bit downmarket. On arrival all staff were friendly and helpful, our rooms were above standard especially the beds! So so comfortable, the pillows a delight. Location was just right for what we wanted to do in the 2 days we were there. Within walking distance of plenty of attractions and restaurants. The ONLY criticism would be the use of plastic cups, cutlery etc in rooms and in the breakfast room. So environmentally unsound and so hard to see how this can be economical.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: SusiDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for several days and I was very impressed with the staff. They were only too helpful & helped us in recommending restaurants etc. The rooms were lovely and it was a very nice place to stay - very central to the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBanton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel April 15,16th for a concert. The room was very modern and spotless, and the bathroom was huge. Staff very friendly and helpful. Also the rooms were very quiet, had a great nights sleep. Breakfast was also great, plenty to choose from. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: FrankMig
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very helpful during our few days at the hotel. They went out of their way to help with directions, places to eat, activities. The room and hotel were fantastic and a great location, few blocks from Highland and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bookclubber13
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and we weren't disappointed. It's in a great location for visiting Hollywood, being only a short walk from the Hollywood and Highland Centre. The room we stayed in wasn't huge, but was big enough for our family of 2 adults, 1 teenager and 1 tween. We were on an extended vacation with plenty of luggage but still felt we had enough room to move around and do what we needed to do. We certainly felt we were getting value for money. The included breakfast was great - it wasn't gourmet but it was plentiful, there was lots of choice and made for a great start to a day of sight-seeing. The only negative comments I would make are regarding the airconditioning and the guest laundry. We had trouble getting the airconditioning to a comfortable temperature and the room was often overhot for our liking. Opening the window helped, but may be an issue for a light sleeper as there is some traffic noise - even in the rooms at the back of the hotel where we were. The noise didn't bother us, but it may some people. The guest laundry was clean and the machines worked well, but there was only one washer and one dryer and we spent a bit of time lining up waiting our turn. A few more of each machine would be very appreciated. We would definitely stay there again if we are ever back in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “great location , helpful staff , very clean and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: clambLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights mainly to do some sightseeing and visit universal studios hollywood .The hotel is 5 mins walk from hollywood walk of fame , chinese mann theatre , madame tussuards ,metro station ( 1 stop from universal studios ) and all tours to stars homes. The hotel was spotlessly clean and staff polite and helpful . the free breakfast is very good as well . Small pool , business centre and gym . Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahBewley
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific experience. I was in LA for the opening of a play I'd written. I received a lovely welcome note from the staff wishing me the best on my opening. While we were there the hotel was great. Good staff, excellent service. The room was quiet and clean. We had rented a car and the valet service was always excellent. The breakfast was good. I highly recommend the cinnamon rolls!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service.......”
Reviews.Author: Ladyt83
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. This hotel is in a great location as you walk a short distance to the Hollywood walk of fame. There was a Starbucks across the street so we would travel there for a treat at night. The hotel itself was clean and well maintaned. The front staff was just amazing every single one of them and the manager was so helpful....The only down side was the pool was very cold and did not feel heated we only realy used it on one day that was 98" outside. We took a cab or a flat rate driver which seemed to be not so bad on several occations to Target yaah Beverly Centre Mall and the Staple Centre and we also went to Santa Monica Peer this was about $50 US we went for the day. I was a single mother with two teens and this was a safe and perfect place to stay. The breakfast buffet is a must we went every morning. I can not say enough how amazing the staff were from the housekeeping to the guy who aranged our cabs and rides. I would stay here again and am planning a trip in Augusts and will stay here I loved the staff at the front you should all be so proud of yourselves you are so knowledgable and so very friendly and caring I was sad to leave. This was worth the money and the stay......

Reviews.Title: “a better second impression of LA”
Reviews.Author: Toowoombatourist
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my second visit to LA. We had stayed downtown five years earlier and had unfortunately come away not enjoying our stay at all. This time we spent three days in town after a Mexican Riviera cruise. We chose this hotel after a fair bit of research, due mainly to it's location closer to all the tourist hotspots, local eateries and it's included breakfast. We were not disappointed this time!! The position was almost perfect and we were able to walk to many of the sightseeing spots or the departure points for the tour buses. Even later at night, we didn't feel unsafe walking back to the Hotel or over to the nearby convenience store or food outlets. The included breakfast was a pleasant surprise.. hot food, toasts, bagels, fruit, juices and pastries -plenty to get you started on your busy day ahead! The lady who staffed this breakfast area was always very friendly and kept the food well stocked no matter what time you come down. The free use of the internet area was also much appreciated to enable you to do last minute sightseeing research or catching up with news from home. The room we had booked included a little kitchenette, a spacious bathroom and a king size bed...all modern & tastefully decorated and quite comfortable. Even though the hotel is on a busy road, there is very little street noise and sleeping was never a problem for either of us. The staff were friendly on check-in, helpful with directions and willingly allowed us to store ( quite a lot of) luggage on the day of check-out due to our late flight home. This Hotel proved to me that position is very important. Our previous stay had been tainted by the poor position of our accomodation - not accessible to sightseeing, restaurants & overall a less safe neighbourhood. Of course, it is also nice to have some of the comforts of home and helpful staff around you.... all of these were found in this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location-comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: mamadino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night on our way to Disneyland. Reading reviews I wasn't sure what to expect, but figured we could manage one night. Overall it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were spacious, clean, & comfortable. Our room was on the 6th floor on the mountain side, so we didn't have much of a view, but we also didn't have any street noise. I was taken by surprise when we pulled in & were told there was a $20 parking fee & the valet was mandatory for Friday/Saturday nights. I came home to look for the parking information on their website & finally found it under the Pet Policy, which since we were not traveling with pets I didn't read. Overall a good hotel that I would consider staying at in the future, but would consider other less expensive ones first.

Reviews.Title: “Measures up to it's good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Griswalds04
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the good reviews and it totally measured up. I stayed here with my young teen daughter to see the Hollywood sights and it was a great base. We felt completely safe. However, we didn't walk alone after dinner much past 9 pm because it is a block up from the Highland Center. Recommend this hotel if you want to stay in a newer, clean property at a very good price when you compare the free interet and breakfasts and reasonable valet charges. The parking garage has murals painted all over the walls and we met the artist while she was painting. Very unique and fun. Recommend a tour of the Kodak Theater and the #1burger and salad at the Roosevelt Hotel. If you're going to Mozzas Pizza call ahead for the take out pizza and then pick it up and park in the 3 minute parking spot on Highland and Melrose.

Reviews.Title: “A good decision”
Reviews.Author: JetlaggedPete
Reviews.Content: First chance to give a belated review of this hotel in Hollywood. Was very apprehensive as it looked on google streetview to be small and on a busy road and not knowing the place had no idea what to expect. Well I can only say that it was a fantastic find and unfortunately for possible future visits is sure to become very popular and therefore busy. Oh well.... it deserves a great review anyway. The location is only the shortest of strolls from the main tourist street of Hollywood and the train station. The staff were friendly and the place was wonderfully clean and seemed well maintained. Street noise was no issue nor activity in the adjoining carparks. Taxis had no trouble arriving quickly or coping with the busy road. A good range of food and eatery choices close by if you explore a little. Until we actually experienced it ourselves, I now know why so many compliment the happy friendliest woman who runs the breakfast room. Goodness me, one morning the place was chaos, full house and everyone wanting to eat at the same time, she didn't miss a beat; coped, smiled, helped...happy...what an advertisement for the friendly face of Holiday Inn!! Hollywood is a bit overated and you can do it in a couple of half days, but this location I now consider is the ideal base to use for a full tourist stay in LA. Its central and easy to get to all the sights and other tourist activities in any direction. This Holiday Inn is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T HAVE BEEN BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: kissingtree2316
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I checked into this hotel last Wednesday March 23rd. At first we experienced a problem with our A/C unit. The guy came up and checked it, filled it with water and it started working again. 10 minutes later, it quit working again. I called the front desk to see if we could move but the hotel was sold out so we had to stay where we were. The temperature in the room wasn't a problem because it wasn't hot outside...all we really needed was a way to move the air around in the room so it worked out fine. Someone came up the next day to fix it and after that we didn't have any issues. The hotel is on a very busy street. I was afraid the traffic noises outside would keep me awake as I am a very light sleeper (hence the need to have the A/C unit operating correctly...to drown out the traffic noise) but I slept fine You can hear the ambulances, trucks and horns but other than that, you can't hear much traffic noise. In fact, the second night I slept like a baby. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. You aren't smack dab on Hollywood Blvd...which would be VERY loud. Its one block North...just a hair away from all the commotion of downtown Hollywood...but just a short walk away from it all. If you have a car, the man that works in the garage will park it for you when you arrive and bring it around for you each morning. It costs $20 a day to park there but its worth it. The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast and the wonderful woman named Marietta that runs the breakfast buffet. She was there each morning with a smile on her face. She had that place running like a well oiled machine. The eggs, bisuits, bacon or cereal never got below half full and the tables were never dirty for more than 30 seconds. She was amazing! The food was very good too to be hotel buffet style food. Good biscuits...good eggs...good bacon...good white sausage gravy and one of the best cinnamon rolls I have ever had! Overall, this is an EXCELLENT hotel. I highly recommend it and would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: mirabellecarlos
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff made our stay very comfortable with their excellent service. Jessica from the front desk was very patient and helpful on our first day, Marieta from the breakfast area was very accomodating and pleasant, the housekeeping and valet people did their job with dedication.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: bd3655
Reviews.Content: Marieta, the woman looking after the breakfast room, does a fantastic job of keeping the room clean, the food fresh, and always with a warm smile and pleasant "good morning".

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant staff and total experience”
Reviews.Author: grammajeanne
Reviews.Content: Everyone was super helpful and friendly. Marieta in the breakfast room was a ray of sunshine. The men in charge of parking cars made life easy. Getting out of the driveway on to the boulevard takes patience. The rooms were good. I tried the pool but it was very cold, understandably! Convenient location to everything, which is why we chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: albertcapaccioli
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from the 1stof March till the 6th. On arrival we were greeted by a very efficient and pleasant young ladie receptionist who informed us of all the hotel had to offer and if we needed any information just ask and she or anybody also would have been very please to help. Our room was very spacious and well appointed ; 2 queen size bed, a very comfortable arm chair, writing desk, large flat screen tv; free local calls ,basically (all calls made within the U.S.A) free internet connection. in room safe and fridge Large bathroom with a good supply of towels and all amenities The room was kept very clean and so the whole of the Hotel Breakfast in the morning consisted of Continental choice with hot buffet. all very efficiently run. Any problem that arose during our stay was dealt promptely and nothing seem to be a bother. The Hotel is centrally located just across the road from the Kodak Theater and the Metro Station. Whenever I will come back to Los Angeles (which will be at least once a year since I used to live there) I will definitely stay at this Hotel and I will be glad to recommend it. Well done and keep up with the good work Alberto (London U.K)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 queen room which was spacious for our family. The included breakfast was great. Gets very crowded at peak time but we were fine as we came down before the peak & always had a free table. We chose this hotel as it's close to the freeway & away fm the crowds in the main Hollywood drag yet a short walk down. My only gripe is the relatively high overnight parking fee but this is Los Angeles so it's to be expected. There's off street parking in the residential area a few streets up the road but we didn't feel so safe leaving our car out at night so we parked in the hotel carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: N80
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,friendly helpful staff. Organized a shuttle to Disneyland for us. Nice sized rooms and free internet. Breakfast was a bit average but it was free so I ate it anyway and the coffee was lousy but good coffee was hard to find the entire trip so it wasn't exclusive to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we've stayed in ever!”
Reviews.Author: NewTraveller37
Reviews.Content: Complimentary Breakfast, Wifi, electronic safe, phone calls. Flat screen tv is great. Windows soundproof. Close to all the major attractions on Hollywood Boulevard (5min walk). At one stage when the internet wasn't connecting, I was given a number to call and a patient lady, Kathy, talked me through my laptop and got it to work. The breakfast is good as a great start to the day but the highlight was Marrieta who works tirelessly to keep the area clean and stocked - the little lady with the big smile! The room was spotless and very spacious. The bed very comfortable. Bathroom large. We were impressed with the overall quality of fixtures and fittings too. The heating/cooling is awesome. The staff is also very good and friendly. Very, very happy with our stay and plan to come back. TIP: You need many weeks in order to explore LA properly and see all the sights. Well done Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms for the price!”
Reviews.Author: auntieadriene
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here. Minimal complaints and only praises about this hotel. It has a great location, which is just off the Hollywood and Highland junction with Kodak theatre etc (can walk there). Service was great and very polite and warm. The room was the star, it was huge! With a seperate writing desk, sofa area, coffee area and dining table! With enough space in the middle to do a dance! We had a small problem with the TV (some cable was loosened) and the engineer came to solve that within 5 minutes of calling. The room came with breakfast which was great and you could enjoy it next to the pool. Downside was that I found the toilet fan slightly noisy (linked to the lights) and the aircon unit near the window was quite noisy. The room could do with more lights as it was quite dim, but probably cos it was so large! Will definetely stay here again if we visit LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: JMichael69
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a very reasonable price! Service was well above average thanks to the manager. Our room was large and very clean. The breakfast was typical for a HI. The location was very good for us and was close to everything in Hollywood. Strip mall close by had a Starbucks, C-store and Subway. We drove and the valet parking was reasonably priced and convenient. Our only complaint was the very slow internet access. My wife and I plan to return to the area in June to visit our daughter and plan to stay at this HI again. I am a Marriott Rewards member but have really liked the HI Express experience and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Hollywood Locations!”
Reviews.Author: CC161
Reviews.Content: It is located on Highland avenue, about a five minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and all the sites. The hotel offers free breakfast and its a decent breakfast with coffee, juice and most items you would need for a day of sightseeing. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves were comfortable with great beds and pillows and a fantastic shower. Would definately recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to spend most of their time in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: NancyR007
Reviews.Content: Convient location about 3 blocks from Hollywood Blvd. No problems walking to and from hotel at night. Nice clean hotel with very helpful staff. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and AWESOME staff”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located to all of the major sites (within walking distance) of Hollywood. Walked to Hollywood Bowl, Hollywood sign, Kodak Theatre, Chinese Theater, Walk of Fame, etc. And all within a few blocks. Rooms are very nice and clean. The staff is amazing! Especially Marletta in the breakfast room. She delivered coffee and water to our room at 4am when we couldn't get our coffee pot working. THANKS AGAIN. Free breakfast and free wifi are appreciated perks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BraveTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after visiting Six Flags. We had our two young adult children with us so we booked two rooms. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start the day. There was something for everyone to fill up on. The only thing lacking at this hotel was any 'concierge' service. The front staff were not very helpful with suggestions but very helpful with calling cabs and accomodating any 'hotel' requests. The location was perfect for walking to Hollywood Blvd. Just a side note that when you are walking back to the hotel from Hollywood Blvd. the first liquor store is much cheaper than the second :) A bit of a drag to have to pay $20/day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deesol714
Reviews.Content: This was a reallly great place to stay. Very colse to where I needed to be. I have to give compliments to the breakfast that is offered too. Also on the women that greats me everyday when I just get in right before the 9:30 cutoff. She always greets me with a warm smile and a goodmorning. The entire staff aims to please in every way they can.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: arnieTsv
Reviews.Content: Arriving before check-in time, expecting to drop our luggage, our rooms were ready and we were checked in. The rooms were comfortable as was the bed and pillows. The room was quiet and the included breakfast was simple but fine. The staff were friendly and helpful and also arranged transportation for us. The location is great, not far to walk from Hollywood Blvd and free wifi was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be close to tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: aleigh7
Reviews.Content: We had a really great stay at this hotel! The service was very friendly and helpful! If you are looking to be in the heart of Hollywood then this hotel if for you. We were in walking distance of the Walk of Fame, the Chinese Theater and a huge outdoor mall. There were also many restaurants in walking distance to choose from which was helpful when you don't want to brave the L.A. streets to find something to eat! The free breakfast at the hotel was delicious! Keep in mind that parking is not free if you intend to drive...it was $22 a day with tax. But it was covered parking in a garage and the valet man was very nice! My only complaint would be that our room was directly above a busy street...HOWEVER, if you are looking for a hotel downtown you are not going to be able to get away from the noise outside. It still didn't stop us from having a great time and getting great sleep! :) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!! Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: FionaWarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January/February 2011. Highly recommend this hotel, all staff were very friendly and helpful. 5 minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the walk of fame/chinese theatre. Room was very nice decor, bed comfortable, in room safe. Hotel has a guest laundry and free breakfast which was SOO good, toast, eggs, bacon, cakes & pastries, coffee & juices - very good. Complimentary use of internet / business centre. We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of our USA trip and it was a wonderful start to the holiday! Would stay here again, as previously stayed in other area's of LA - this was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean ,convenient for tourists.Great breakfast. Thankyou!”
Reviews.Author: JANal50
Reviews.Content: Would defineatly stay again when in the area. We walked everywhere except our tour to beaches and beverly hills etc. Good crepes restaurant can sit outside at upper level of mall. very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: tr59
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Jan. 2011 with my 2 daughters and I felt very comfortable and safe here at the Holiday Inn Express.
