There was one lady who was really nice and helpful and the others were just trying to do their Reception work. The guys at the parking very nice and helpful. One thing I did not like on the day of our departure from the hotel is that when I asked the lady (Monica) at the Reception about the possibility of booking a shuttle to the airport, she told me that I was supposed to reserve the shuttle the night before so I did not insist. Later on when we came back to the room, I called Super Shuttle and they booked us for the same afternoon to go to the airport so before leaving the hotel I mentioned to her that it could be possible to book the shuttle the same day of departure. Otherwise the location is great. You are about 3 blocks from Hollywood Boulevard Walk of Fame and the metro station that takes you to Universal Studios (one stop only). Since we did not want to rent a car, we took a tour of LA. I realised that taking taxis to the different sites we wanted to visit was going to be costly and since LA is such a big city, we would have not been able to see all we wanted to see in those 4 days. We really enjoyed Universal Studios but it was really hot there! as the San Fernando Valley is always a few grades hotter than LA city.

Reviews.Title: “A great affordable, comfortable hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jellycomics
Reviews.Content: My decision to stay in this Hollywood Holiday Inn Express hotel was based on the reviews that i read from this site, and what a really pleasant stay my friend and I had! I have always been a bit wary of Holiday Inn hotels, mainly bcos of the impression I have of this chain being a mid standard hotel. But boy, was I pleasantly surprised!! Not only was the location of this hotel fantastic (a 10 minute walk from the Hollywood and Highland shopping centre, Graumann's Chinese Theatre, etc), but the rooms and facilities were clean and NEW! We could choose between soft and firm pillows, the bed mattresses were excellent, and we got a little weather card daily to tell us what the temperature would be! We had a tough time deciding between this hotel and the Hollywood Hills Hotel (HHH) right next door, partly bcos the latter hotel has a beautiful website. So we decided to check their neighbour out, and we were happy to say that we made the right decision to choose Holiday Inn Express!! For a decent, not-too-many frills (basic but clean dining room, small trendy lobby, plain modest entrance) stay in Hollywood, this hotel is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Hollywood Bowl and Hollywood Sites”
Reviews.Author: AZPeregrina
Reviews.Content: It's higher priced than most HI Expresses, but the location couldn't be any better. We stayed here one night to go to a show at the Hollywood Bowl--which was a phenomenal experience. This hotel is nearer than many parking lots to the Bowl, but it's still quite a walk if you have mobility issues. The friendly valet called us a cab, which was about $5 to the Bowl entrance. After the show, we just walked back to the hotel. It's about half a mile. Just south of the hotel is the touristy part of Hollywood Boulevard, and that was fun to see. It was all it up like Las Vegas, and there were lots of tourists. Everyone at this hotel was very friendly, but the valets were super. Parking is $22/night, I think. You self-bus with valet carts provided at the parking valet. The free breakfast includes eggs and bacon and is very good. The pool is small and outdoors, and there is no jacuzzi. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and we had a nice view of the Hollywood Hills. There is no hotel restaurant, but the front desk offered many takeout menus. We ordered from the Indian place, and it was great. I recommend the tandoori chicken salad. I can't find any fault with this hotel other than a small pool, having to take multiple elevators, and the high total cost. But we knew we were paying for location. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rock_30
Reviews.Content: Probably the best holiday express I have stayed in. The location couldn't be faulted - just 5 mins walk (if that) to Graumans Chinese theatre etc from where you can explore LA. There is also a few stores just across the road. Hotel seemed brand new, clean and spacious. Asked for a quiet room and didn't hear a thing. Pool looked good, but we were there only 3 days and there's too much in LA to sit around a pool all day. Breakfast clean and fully stocked all the time - standard holiday inn contiental style breakfast - just enough to start the day. Would defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in heart of hollywood”
Reviews.Author: WemberlyWi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only one year old, so still in great condition. Front desk staff friendly throughout stay. Received two rooms as reserved. One room had view of wall directly in front of window, so requested room with city view and received it immediately at no additional charge. Rooms clean and decently sized with desk, big chair, large TV, fridge. Bathrooms clean with standard cinnamon scented amenities. Wireless worked in one room but not the other. Hotel provided us with ethernet cable during stay. Parking an additional cost but worth it because safe and connected to hotel elevators. Area has large amount of traffic and with events at Hollywood Bowl would have made finding our own parking incredibly frustrating. Stayed three nights and location was perfect for our L.A. visit. Breakfast was standard HI Express fare and tasty. Seating is limited given size of hotel. Get there early if you don't want to miss the cinnamon rolls. Pool and weight room. Tried all-in-one machine for weight lifting, kinda confusing but okay. Sister liked elliptical. Laundry machines satisfactory. Halls can kind of wind around, especially above 5th floor but not too bad once you learn your way. Area ideas include: The Hideout, inside the Hollywood Heights Hotel, is just a few doors down from HI Express. Went for dinner, service and food was excellent - try the sweet potato fries. The mini strip mall across from the HI Express has a decent Subway (with fresh avocado) and a small grocery with a Pizza Bella pizzeria inside - these are above average options for late night noshing - take food to your room though. Another pizza place in the neighborhood is just off Hollywood,at Yucca and Ivar, called Village Pizzeria. This serious NYC 'za is awesome. Create your own slice and save room for the italian ices. Finally, if you're a make-up junkie like me, there is a Sephora just a few blocks walking distance within the enormous open air mall along the walk of fame called the Hollywood & Highland Center. Highly recommend this hotel, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leobabe
Reviews.Content: Would reccomend anyone to stay here. We arrived after 4 nights in Las Vegas and loved the quiet location of hotel but able to walk within 5 minutes to walk of fame, restuarants, sightseeing tours. Staff lovely and helpful, rooms clean and pool peaceful, free internet access.Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: bognor
Reviews.Content: Comfortable new hotel with many excellent features. Spacious, quiet rooms, eye-level wall safes, curved shower rails, full length mirror, separate reading lights, free breakfast with good coffee, free business centre. Top of the 'budget' category with better features but less services than many 4/4.5 star hotels. They've even got towels big enough to wrap around my big belly! Highly recommended but there were two adverse factors you should consider: 1/ The aircon works but it is noisy - it only works on auto which means it woke me up at night as it comes on and goes off again. 2/ the hotel is excellent and well situated for the Walk of Fame but do you really want to be there? We spent 3 nights here which was about two too many since the area has few decent bars or restaurants and is full of people on the scrounge - panhandlers, nut jobs and 'servers' who spend more time telling you about their 'gratuities policy' than getting your order right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , good service, good location for seeing hollywood”
Reviews.Author: BUNSTERBOO
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel from Las Vegas - we took the Luxbus from Vegas which took 4 1/2 hours. It was a really pleasant journey. the bus was modern and drinks, snacks and movies were provided. there was also a stop along the way. This bus was only $64! We stayed at this hotel from the 2 June 2009 to the 6 June 2009. We stayed in a standard room which was well laid out and of a good size. it had all of teh usual bits and pieces...nice smellies in the bathroom, a good hairdryer, two large and very comfortable double beds, TV with many channels, air con, fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The rooms were very clean and we had new towels anmd sheets every day. Breakfast was included and there was plenty of choice. the breakfast attendant was also very helpful and chatty. The pool was quite small, but it was warm and very clean and very well received after a hot day out and about. The hotel was about 5 mins walk from Hollywood Boulevard where you could get transport to most locations. One day we took the metro to universal studios which was only one stop away. The tube was clean and not busy. We then took the free shuttle bus from the metro station to Universal Studios. The second day we took the metro bus from hollywood boulevard to Santa monica and had a fab day...if you go try Bubba Gumps the shrimp if awesome! We walked from Sanat Monica to Venice beach it was a nice walk but it took a good hour. Venice Beach is nothing special and once you have seen it you are ready to go back to Santa Monica! The bus service was great and cost only $5 each to hop and ond off all day. We also took the Bus to Beverly Hills, Farmers Market and The Grove all for $5 all day travel what a bargain. I would say this hotel is a good base to explore Hollywood and if you dont mind travelling a good base to explore further afield. I woudl definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traybird
Reviews.Content: We had four adults and one toddler. We stayed in the two queen deluxe room on the fourth floor and it was a great stay! We had lots of room to spread out and for our toddler to run around. The hotel seemed brand new or newly renovated. It was a great location and the Galleria mall area is so convenient and enjoyable. We ate three of our meals there and loved it. The breakfast at the hotel was very decent and convenient. We didn't use the pool but it looked pretty nice. The beds and pillows were really comfortable too. The hotel staff was friendly and super helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay there again if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mwooduk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night using Priority Club points. The valet and the check in desk staff were excellent, some of the nicest people we met in our one week drive down the Pacific Coast HIghway. We got a gift bag at check in with chips and water (nice treat!) and the rooms were spacious and great. Breakfast was excellent and the business center was open late (very handy - something that was a problem at other hotels we stayed at in CA) and we have no complaints at all. The pool is small but seemed to be heated. No jacuzzi but a handy little workout room which I did get to use. Parking is $20 a night. You are in the heart of Hollywood and even though getting into the hotel i.e. crossing traffic is a pain as other reviewers have intimated, you can easily go up Highland Avenue, past the hotel and turn left at the next intersection, and then just come back down the hill and turn right into the hotel. We were glad that other Trip Advisor reviewers had warned about this though as it helped us be on the lookout for it. You can walk to the Grauman Chinese Theatre and the Hollywood Walk of Fame easily (10 minutes) and Paramount is close by. There is also a great mall with lots of restaurants right next to the Grauman Theatre where you can have your photo taken with the Hollywood sign in the background. The rooms are large and have coffee and a frig. Nice bathroom with great amenities. Really, a very good and convenient place to stay and the jacaranda trees all over Hollywood were blooming - it was pretty!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: sukidsntravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night to see the walk of fame. Excellent price for the location, clean and friendly concierge- when we arrived tired and hot. Only a very short safe walk to the sights, even with 9 and 6 yr olds in tow. We ate at the u- wink- kids loved the create your own burger and the games at the table (actually so did the adults). The pool is small but just right for a little swim. The free breakfast very generous and perfect to start the day. All in all an excellent spot for seeing exactly what we wanted to see, the walk of fame, graumans theatre, kodak theatre etc. Also a short drive away from the best spot to see the hollywood sign - Griffith observatory. Don't hesitate to book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lemmingstone
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I stayed at the Hollywood Heights Hotel formerly the Holiday Inn Hollywood and was impressed by the location. This hotel is right next door so even closer to Hollywood Blvd. Everything about this hotel was perfect. The rooms were spacious and very clean, bedding was very comfortable, pool was fine, breakfast is included, internet is free, convenient car parking, safe etc. Every staff member we dealt with were very pleasant, helpful and willing to help make our stay better. The location is supurb with a convenience store, pizza, Starbucks right accross Highland Ave. Hollywood and Highland is just 5 mins walk away with access to plenty of sights and Metro station. Universal Studios 10-15 mins away. I would definately recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Hollywood for any reason. I will stay here everytime I come to LA. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful”
Reviews.Author: adamsduo
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful hotel, the location was great and the staff very helpful. The room were clean and so was the pool. The hotel is smokefree and there are no benches available so be prepared to stand if you are a smoker. The parking valet was great too, however I do feel that guests of the hotel should not have to pay 20.00 a day to park. You can walk to just about everything in town and you can see the hollywood sign from the street.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: montecarla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and absolutely loved it. I was a bit concerned about staying at a HI Express, but we were more than pleased! It is definitely a gem among alot of other choices in LA/Hollywood. The location is excellent. You are walking distance from the walk of fame and it literally took us 10 minutes to drive to the Warner Bros. studios. We took the subway to the Staples Center to see a hockey game as recommended by the hotel staff and it was very easy to find (and cost effective)! The rooms are beautiful, clean and roomy and the whole building smells brand new! The staff was very friendly and helpful - they assisted us in booking tours, giving directions, and they had no problem in moving us to the 4th floor after our first night. We wanted to be close to the breakfast area/fitness room and our location was great! The valet service was also very good and we were always greeted with a smile whenever coming or going. In closing, we would definitely stay at this hotel the next time we travel to LA and will be recommending it to our friends and family! Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Luv2CtheGlobe
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn express was a good value compared to the surroundingarea hotels. This hotel is clean and seems relatively new. The rooms are large and clean with a nice flatscreen TV. The beds are really comfortable. They also have free internet here. The bathroom is also very large and has a nice shower with great water pressure. The free breakfast is also very good, but crowded every morning. They have cinammon rolls, eggs, bacon, biscuits, fruits, cereal, yogurt, milk and various juices. The pool is also very clean. The hotel is in easy walking distance (less than 5 minutes) from the walk of fame. There is also a nice outdoor mall with several restaurants really close. The only downside to this hotel is the $22 daily parking fee, which is ridiculous! Lastly, If you stay here, request a room on the 5th floor because the fitness center, pool and breakfast area are on the 4th floor, so you will be above them. Also, if you are on the 6th floor or up, you have to take an elevator to the 5th floor, get off, and walk down the hall to another elevator to take you to the rest of the floors. That was a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogs5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a suite (sofabed/refrigerator, etc) with husband and teenage son that I booked through Holiday Inn's website as a priority club member. Very spacious with flatscreen TV. The price for this room was cheaper than other hotels' standard double rooms. Incredible free breakfast (hot & cold) included. Walking distance to many attractions including Graumann's Chinese Theater. Tour companies have their kiosks in that area. We booked a 2-hr movie star tour of Hollywood/Beverly Hills, which was great. Hotel wanted to "book " a tour for us, but we decided against it after we let them get a cab for ride to Universal for a flat fee of $20 when the return trip by metered cab was only $13.00!! Otherwise, the experience at this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tweetiepie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Express on the 20th - 22nd of April and were in room 516 on the 5th floor. We booked through the website for $282 for the 2 nights. This was our first time in LA (we'd just spent 12 nights in Vegas and were on our way up the coast) and having only 2 days we thought it best to stay in the middle of it all and the hotel was very well placed for this. On arrival we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor, then the gentleman on reception mentioned the breakfast room was on the floor above this - I queried if we were directly below it (as we had just been in a really noisy hotel and I needed to get some sleep!) and he said 'no but tell you what i'll upgrade you anyway' - how nice. We had just booked a standard king room but he gave us an exec room instead which had a bit more space. This was very kind of him and he was very helpful the whole time. The room did face the street, which was very busy and noisy, but as we needed the aircon on both nights (it got up to 102 at one point) it drowned out any noise anyway, so it wasn't an issue. The room was very nice and spacious, with a sink and fridge in the sitting area. The bathroom was very small but clean and everything worked well. The 2 main reasons we booked this hotel were (apart from the good reviews) the fact that you got internet access and breakfast as part of the price. The internet access was available in the room/ wi-fi and in the business centre (2 computers in a room beside the pool which never seemed to be busy) we didn't ever have any issues getting connected in the room. The breakfast room overlooked the pool and the cereal/ toast/ eggs/ sausage were a good start to each day. The hotel offers valet and self parking but they both cost $22/ day so we opted for valet, not that it made much difference as it's a tiny car park just off reception. But the car park attendants were always quick and friendly. The hotel is a 5 min walk (only that long due to traffic) to the Hollywood & Highland shopping complex which we ate at both nights (uWink & California pizza kitchen) and the walk of fame is on the other side of this. Overall this hotel was very nice with great staff, in a decent location for touristy stuff and I would happily return if I were in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting LA”
Reviews.Author: Zanika2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Holiday Inn Express Hollywood Walk of Fame, and I was incredibly impressed with the overall experience. I've stayed at a lot of Holiday Inn hotels for work, and I'd have to say this is one of the best I've stayed in yet. The hotel was in the perfect location for Hollywood tourism. Within walking distance to Hollywood Blvd, I walked down to the Kodak theater, and the Chinese theater. While I was there a movie premier was going on, and it was great to see it all happen. The room was very spacious, and the best was quite comfortable. The only challenge to the hotel was the elevator switch; if you are in the top floors you have to transfer elevators. But that really wasn't too big of a deal, considering the location and great rooms. Parking was $20 a day, which was kind of lame. You won't be disappointed with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilloconnell11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel from a long flight from the UK. The reception staff were very helpful and polite and made us feel really welcome. Our room was fantastic, clean and very spacious. Although we faced out to the side of the hotel, overlooking the main road, it was not noisy at all. Our room was cleaned every day to a very high standard. Breakfast was excellent value with a good selection of hot and cold foods. We went to breakfast different times over our stay and found there was always a good selection to choose from. The staff at breakfast were always very welcoming and always smiling. The reception staff were always very helpful with any information we required. The hotel itself was very central and convenient for getting around Hollywood (Hollywood & Highland Shopping Mall, restaurants and sightseeing), although I recommend if you want to go further a field I highly recommend hiring a car, LA is vast, which we did. Thank you to the hotel staff for making our holiday really special. We had a fantastic time in LA and would highly recommend anyone to stay here it is a really excellent, friendly, convenient and well presented hotel. We would definately stay here again if we go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel. You wont be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: coantrimtripadviser
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Holiday Inn Express, Hollywood Walk of Fame. Never having been in the USA before, we didn't really know what to expect, so relied on Tripadvisor's reviews. Well you wont be disappointed if you book this hotel. Set in an ideal location, just up from the Highland Centre on Hollywood Walk of Fame, with a tube station there to take you up to Universal, or catch a tour bus for Hollywood and Beverly Hills, jump on and off to suit yourself, perhaps at Rodeo Drive! We were a party of four and booked a room with two doubles. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, with fresh linen daily. The breakfast is worthwhile with fruit, cereal and pastries etc. I must mention the tiny little lady who does the breakfasts. She is absolutely wonderful, always busy yet smiling and can't do enough to make sure your day starts off brightly. Great value for money hotel, wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Hollywood. Great location, no need for a car. First class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AM2_Toronto
Reviews.Content: For a first time tourist to Hollywood or a regular visitor, this hotel was great. It is in a great location to walk to a lot of tourist locations like the Hollywood and Highland Mall and the Walk of Fame. Plus it is a short and easy drive to the studios in the valley. One of the coolest things about this hotel other than it is newly renovated and so clean, are the soft and firm pillows on the beds. The pillow cases actually say firm or soft on them. So you get to choose what kind of pillow works best for you. The staff are helpful, the breakfast is simple but good and the area is safe. There is traffic noise, but you can't really get away from that in LA. I would definitely stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “good value and nice stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: thislandisyourland
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Renaissance Hotel a few hundred yards down Highland Avenue from this hotel. But, on this vacation, I decided to watch my wallet and stay at the Holiday Inn on North Highland. The cost is about half of the Renaissance. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms nicely appointed, the WiFi works well and is free and in-and-out parking will set you back $22 a day. For what it's worth, compared to the Renaissance down the road, the rooms are very comparable. The free breakfast from 6:30 AM - 9:15 AM is decent including both hot and cold food. A 5 minute walk (no worry, very safe) brings you to Hollywood and Highland, the hub of the area and the location of one of the city's subway stops, for you non-believers in mass transit LA-style). The staff are very friendly and helpful (but there is usually only one person at the front desk and at busier times this is suboptimal) and the lobby is clean and neat. All in all a very good value and location for anyone wanting to stay in Hollywood and especially off the beaten path of Hollywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skytrucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hollywood for 2 nights during our holiday to California and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and spacious. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming. Internet access was included with the price of the room. Valet/parking was reasonable for LA at $20 per night. Hotel was easily located from Highway 101, Universal Studios 3 miles down the road, walking distance to Kodak Theatre area / Walk of Fame. The only bad comment we have about our stay here was the plastic cutlery and paper plates used for breakfast. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Cathaycaptain
Reviews.Content: as with all Holiday Inn hotels, you get what you pay for, clean, comfortable and relaxing. Front desk staff are always friendly!..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great staff”
Reviews.Author: saemjoju
Reviews.Content: A little hardto find at night, we drove right by it, saw a Best Western and a Comfort Inn. After getting to another Hoilday Inn Express up the road we were given better directions, The hotel needs better signage. Very nice room, spacious and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was fine, typical of Holiday Inn Express. Get there early, food seems to run out quickley, bacon was served one day for about an hour then gone. Sausage substituted for rest of stay. Only one toaster available that can cause delays. Most impressed with the staff we met, everyone quite helpful and courteous. From our experience the staff makes the hotel. There is a fee for parking in the garage of $22/day

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chootysmf
Reviews.Content: My mother, sisters and I stayed at this hotel from Mar.27th thru the 31st. We had a very pleasant stay. The hotel itself was very nice & clean. Service was great! Out of everyone, this was my first trip to LA ...so this hotel was perfect for me to get out and walk around to see the sights. Everything was pretty convenient to get to...sights, shops, etc. Across the street from the hotel was convenient store and some eating places. We tried the sushi place across the street and it was very good. From the outside it didn't look so "nice", but inside it was very clean & service was very good. Aside from that, we did rent a car so we could go to Malibu, Santa Monica, etc...and we had no problems getting in and out of the hotel. Yes, there was traffic...and yes it's a busy street and intersection...but we made due...people were pretty polite letting us in and out . We had no problems getting where we needed to get and the valet service at the hotel was fine. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to LA...it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Provide recycling bins and this hotel would be absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter and I stayed four nights over the school spring break to explore LA and tour a couple of area colleges. We arrived late night and the drive to the hotel was daunting! Wow. LA driving is intense! The drive from LAX to the hotel seemed "hit or miss"; barred windows, street signs heavily laden with graffiti, definitely a strange vibe. When we arrived at the hotel, however, we couldn't have been more pleased. Everyone, and I mean everyone at the Holiday Inn Express was friendly and welcoming. The valet staff (if you choose this option as opposed to self-park), the front desk, housekeeping; everyone had a smile and a genuine interest in making sure we were comfortable. We could not have been more delighted. Rooms were spacious (two queen beds), very clean, and didn't have that "layer of way too many travelers been here" film that so many hotels seem to have. Our view wasn't much, but we weren't here to take in the view from our hotel room. A very short walk to Graumann's Theatre, the Kodak Theatre, El Capitan, California Pizza Kitchen (CPK), and more. Blocks from In 'N Out Burger and Mel's. Can see the "Hollywood" sign from the mall balcony near CPK. Excellent access to 101 for a quick trip to Universal Studios and/or Warner Brothers. There's a 24 hour market and a 24 hour Subway directly across the street. The hotel also offers beverages and microwave meals in their "concession" area in the front lobby. The complimentary breakfast buffet was quite nice and the sweet lady who manages the buffet takes obvious pride in her work. All in all, a wonderful, affordable experience. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean new hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3/14 - 3/17. The hotel is easy to get to off highway 101. Highland Blvd. is a very busy street so turning left out of the hotel parking lot is almost impossible, you have to go another way if you need to go north on Highland, like if you are going to Universal Studios which is not far up 101. The hotel is very new and is therefore very clean. The staff was always friendly and always greeted us warmly with a smile - the front desk staff, the parking attendant, the maids and the breakfast buffet custodian, everybody. The lobby is tiny and only consists of the front desk. Everything else is on the 4th floor, which is good for security purposes. There is a convenience store and a few food places across HIghland, but I felt a bit uncomfortable going there because there are bums that hang out in the parking lot. However they did not bother us for handouts or harass us in any way, it's just a little disconcerting that they are around. The location of the hotel is very convenient to Hollywood Blvd, practically around the corner from the famous Graumann's Theater. Be aware that it is an uphill walk back to the hotel from there, but it is only about 2 - 3 blocks. You can find lots of places to eat there too - we went to the Disney Soda Fountain for an ice cream treat right at the corner of Highland and Hollywood, yum! Our room was an executive queen suite, which was a very large room for a family of four and probably fit 6 comfortably. It was offered to us at the same price as the standard two queen room so it was a good deal at the time. There is no separate living room, just an arched wall separating the beds from the sofabed. The sofabed, being new, was in good shape and not lumpy or uneven. When opened there was still plenty enough space to maneuver around. The queen beds were wonderful and I liked that they provided lots of pillows on the beds. I added photos of the room so you can see how it looks. We were on the 4th floor which was THE BEST, get a room there if you can because all the amenities are there - business center, pool and FREE breakfast buffet. Our room was in a corner of the building and was a few steps from all the amenities and I felt safe letting my 12 and 9 year old daughters run out to breakfast alone to grab a bite in the morning while I finished getting ready. Even though our room was right along Highland Blvd, we never heard traffic noises, and like I said it's a very busy street. I wasn't expecting much from the breakfast buffet because it was free but I was pleasantly surprised. Every morning, there were eggs, bacon or sausage, an array of bready items (bagels, bread, muffins, pastries, cereal), juices, milk and coffee/tea. A very decent start to our day. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel. I would stay here again if I'm ever in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Like Ronseal - It does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: British_Batman
Reviews.Content: It's a Holiday Inn hotel in Hollywood and it does just that. The location is excellent for Hollywood Boulevard, literally a five minute walk but far enough away not to be too bothered by the noise. The road the hotel is on does get busy in the mornings so it's worth asking for one of the quieter rooms at the back or side. The hotel itself is standard fare with reasonably sized rooms, excessively large bathrooms and a gym and pool. The lifts are incredibly slow though and were a constant frustration. The free continental breakfast is good and sorts you out for a few hours, so you cannot complain about that. The staff on reception were competent enough and friendly but they do only recommend one of the tour companies on the boulevard so it is worth shopping around because there are better deals available with other tour companies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolg903
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for an LA trip. It is within walking distance (1 block) of the Kodak theatre, Walk of Fame, and the Metro. I definitely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again. The hosts were friendly, courteous and very helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. Parking beneath the hotel seemed a bit pricey but after we realized how limited parking is in this area, we were thankful our rental was safe and secure with the 24 hour attendant. We had friends visit us in the hotel and they allowed them to park there briefly at no charge. I believe there is a visitor rate as well. Morning breakfast was fine and well attended. The hostess was friendly and kept the area clean. The hotel is located across the street from a Starbucks, a liquor store, and a convenience store which proved handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with some staff issues.”
Reviews.Author: travel2006j
Reviews.Content: On a positive note, the buildings and rooms looked modern and clean. The room was quiet and the door blocked out the silly music in the hallway. For a tourist, the location is good. It's a couple blocks from the Hollywood and Highland shopping complex and metro stop. A serviceable breakfast was included in the price. The business center included two computers and printer. There's a convenience store and daytime Starbucks across the street. Negatives: Some of the staff appeared immature or inexperienced. When I tried checking in, the two staff members looked overwhelmed although there were only a few people checking out. I was asked to have a seat, which I didn't mind, but was promptly forgotten. When checking out, the desk staff person had a personal laptop and cell phone out. Our car was vandalized as was one other car. We learned there are no security cameras in the garage. I know the hotel is not responsible but it's something to be warned about. Driving into and out of the hotel is hectic with traffic The wi-fi is slow and frequently stops working. Housekeeping skipped our room even though we took the Do Not Disturb sign away and were out by 9:30 AM and were back in the late afternoon. Also at check-in, we were given a half-used bottle of lotion. Not the biggest deal, but it just added to the holes in service. Neutral: Parking is $22 with tax. On par with the area but it's something to take into consideration if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good experience, and would recommend this hotel to others”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: My four-year-old daughter and I enjoyed staying at the Holiday Inn Express Walk of Fame. The hotel was well-located and clean, the price was reasonable, and the staff were friendly - particularly the night desk clerk, whom we saw a lot of due to jet lag. Breakfast, which was included in the price of our room, was pretty good, with a selection of pre-made omlettes, sausage, toasted bagels, cinnamon buns and 2-3 juices. It runs from 6:30 to 9:30 only, and I recommend getting there early, as swarms of pensioners seem to show up at 6:30 on the dot and grab all the sausages. There is no room service, although there are soft drinks and snacks on sale in the lobby. If I had any complaints with this hotel, it would be that the friendly young people working at the desk seem to be under a lot of pressure to sell pre-packaged city tours. Perhaps this is part of their compensation. At any rate, any request for directions around town had them pulling out their color pamphlets and recommending the most expensive, five-hour tour, and encouraging us to book now, now, NOW! Parents of young children: we found the hotel pretty well childproofed, with a plexiglass fence around the pool. The only negative for my (tall) daughter is that bathroom faucets were placed so far back that she had to be lifted up whenever it was time to wash her hands. In general, however, we were happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms, perched above the action, and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: driftador
Reviews.Content: I did a king executive suite (quote unquote)... call it what it is, a large standard room with couch. Quiet, clean, tasteful earth tones and LCD with plenty of cable channels. Parking is fine, and reasonable. I usually stay at the Renaissance next door and talk about inflated costs, time-consuming elevators and walking...way more expensive than this quaint hideaway just a 5-minute walk from the heart of tourist Hollywood. I don't do tourist, just stop here when in area for business. So I can say that knowing when/how to drive around here is the biggest concern you shd have. ;) I'd rather be driving in Mexico City... Excellent golf options close by. Bathrooms are spacious and nicer than some Hyatts. Room felt clean and climate control was flexible with added value in always-on fan white noise. As always, HIE has some great locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Service-Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1KathrynK
Reviews.Content: After quickly checking out of an Inn just down the street, it was a welcome relief to check into this almost brand new facility. The staff was super-hotel was spotless clean-breakfast area was large, bright and had a nice selection of offerings-pool was heated and our accessible room was spacious. It was just a short walk to the Hollywood and Highland attractions. The beds were very comfortable-ample lighting in the rooms and a great flat screen TV. We were visiting family and any future out-of -towners will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing we went for my husbands 28 birthday I used my hotel points so it was a free stay. Beds comfortable, rooms quiet, great location, pool and continental breakfast. Everything we love in a hotel they had.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with experience”
Reviews.Author: Denali07
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say as many nice things about this hotel as others but unfortunately I cannot. The best thing about the place is the location as it is a short walk to a metro stop and the Hollywood and Highland center. We stayed two nights and because the hotel was full we were given one of the smaller rooms (I guess you have to request a large room). So I didnâ€™t think that the rooms were spacious. They were just average. The wireless internet in the room rarely worked. They gave me a password to access the wireless, but it didnâ€™t work. Somehow I stumbled on another wireless site that worked sometimes. Our TV worked only some of the time and then when it was time to watch the football bowl games on New Yearâ€™s Day it didnâ€™t work at all! They sent a guy to the room to try to fix it, but even though he tried for more than 30 minutes, it didnâ€™t work. Not at all â€“ no picture and no sound - no TV. They offered to move us the next day to another room but we were checking out. I canâ€™t say much good about management either. I had a problem with part of my iPod Touch case being thrown away but the manager wouldnâ€™t even give me the courtesy of talking with me about it. The people at the desk tried to help but because of the times we were actually in the hotel the housekeeping manager wasnâ€™t there so I had to call the hotel twice to have them check to see what happened to the case cover. I canâ€™t imagine why the housekeeper would have thrown it away. It wasnâ€™t in the trash can although Iâ€™ll admit that it was left on the floor next to one of our suitcases. But so was the cup that was left from the last guest who had been in the room and that I found under the drapes when I was looking for the case cover. I suppose if you canâ€™t see the trash it doesnâ€™t count. The reason I had the case on the floor was because I had to put one suitcase on the floor as there was only one suitcase stand. I would not recommend the hotel for the way it treats its guests.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: pinkimckie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for a few nights at the start of our trip and then again for a week at the end of our trip. Overall we had a great time would definently stay there again. Room service (we ordered pancakes and bacon and eggs) was really great! Not too badly priced.. we also ate at the restaurant once or twice, wasn't the cheapest place, probably normal for a hotel restaurant, the food was also great. We liked the location of the hotel for its proximaty to Hollywood Boulevard (not too close not to far) but there was some building works going on next door which was very loud in the morning, we had that noise the first stay then stayed on the other side of the hotel the second time and had the Nth Highland Ave traffic. In all we were happy with the hotel, the staff were nice and helpful, the beds and bathroom nice, clean and comfy and the food was good. No laundry though, which was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jchCalgary_Alberta
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at a different hotel in LA in November...and it was a DUMP! I must say that we had higher hopes for the Holiday inn...and it was great! The rooms are beautiful and classy, and the bathroom was amazing! I came home and actually missed the shower! haha It is a great location to the Hollywood walk of fame and other attractions, and so close to the Metro (which is how we get around) We would totally stay there again!!! The only negative thing was when we were checking in, we asked how much the total was...we thought to ourselves...wow taxes must be alot...but came to find out that they were charging us more than what we were quoted in our confirmation email. (which I'm glad I had with me, because she wasn't going to honor the price) once she saw the email, she did change it, but I'm happy we had that with us! so double check your bill!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: imfox
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Room was spacious and beds were good. Very close to tourist attractions and subway station. Some food was available at reception (frozen meals, etc) which was very handy if you wanted to stay in but needed food. Also a number of food shops (Subway, pizza place, liquor shop, snakcs) The microwave and fridge in the room was very handy. Breakfast was very good - muffins, yogurt, cereal, croissants, etc and a few hot dishes each day. Only criticism is that they didn't have any high chairs in the breakfast area - meal times with an infant are much more enjoyable if you don't have to hold them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: V.V.Happy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days before driving up to Las Vegas - and we loved it!!!! The room we had was on the fourth floor looking out the fron. We had requested a Hollywood sign view room if possible but where we were in the right direction there was a building in the way but there isn't anything the hotel themselves can do about that. The whole hotel was clean, welcoming and the room was huge. The breakfast room was great and they will even do you a breakfast box if that would be better, the woman there really couldn't do enough. The Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre and Chinese Theatre are less than 5 minustes walk away and are great places to visit. One thing to watch out for is the payment side. We had paid it fully in advance as far as we were concerned (how we got a cheaper rate) but when we got there they said we had only paid for 1 night and that the other night would be charged when we left and we had to call the credit card company to try and figure it out. Was a bit confusing but worked out in the end. The rection staff we more than helpful though and gave us directions and maps without any trouble and were genuinely nice about it. Would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: littlepatty
Reviews.Content: My hats off to the wonderful staff at this hotel!! We had a wonderful stay. I wish we had stayed our entire trip at your establishment but alas we are California vacation ametuers and booked another hotel closer to Disneyland for the other half of our stay---what a let down after staying here! Staff was wonderful, friendly, and very informative. The breakfast was a nice surprise each morning---not the same 'ol lame 'ol every morning. Rooms are clean and plenty of room. Starbucks across the street and we felt safe with our small children walking in and all around the hotel and attractions nearby. Everyone complains about the parking but hey, check out New York and what they charge to park your rental car!!! We will for sure stay here our next trip to Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: bluelobster1
Reviews.Content: I am always disappointed with Hotels in city centres/close to attractions but not this time. We had had a long flight and a painful drive from LA airport (LA is a nightmare to drive around) and found the hotel clean, modern and the staff very helpful. the rooms were very nice with big flat TV and Tea/Coffee and a comfortable bed. Only thing i will say is that were awoken by what sounded like music playing or a loud Tv at about 4am. Other than that it was what we needed and central to the walk of fame/bus tour pick up etc. Gutted i forgotten the ladys name on reception who located me to where i could by a british travel plug adapter so i could use my hair straighteners. She was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian04
Reviews.Content: Previous to our stay at this hotel, we reseached for hours and hours to find just the right combination of good location, safety and not too pricy. Plus being a group of late twenties, we wanted to be near all the action! This place was very close to the Hollywood walk of fame and close to loads of great stores too. Across the street was a perfect combination of Starbucks, beer/liqour and snacks, quite convient. The staff were extra helpful in our planning to arrange getting taxis for a day in Santa Monica and getting to several other places. That alone was priceless. The hotel itself was nice and pretty modern, could def use new carpets thou. But the breakfast was incredible. Very hot and fresh and being a heath inspector, I was very pleased with the general sanitation and overall food safety practices. The staff were generally very friendly, except not so much with the night staff, but the day staff were always smiling, it was great to see. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Outstanding Staff, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: misshappygolucky
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old son and I were in town to see The Who at the Nokia Theatre and stayed here from November 5-10th based on the positive reviews posted on this site - let me tell you we were NOT disappointed by our choice!! The location couldn't be better -a short 5 minute walk down Highland and you're at the Kodak Theatre, Chinese Theatre, Jimmy Kimmel's nighttime home, The Metro subway train, which we used to take us to the Nokia theatre on Sunday night , we were at the theatre within a half hour and only a $1.25 for each of us - Note: it takes two trains to get there. L.A. Tours is also just up from the corner and we booked our 5 1/2 tour thru them which took us around Hollywood, out to Venice Beach/Santa Monica and the Stars homes along Mulholland Drive/Bel Air. Great little supermarket AND a Starbucks across the street from the hotel - always felt very safe. Van Morrison was doing a two nighter at the Hollywood Bowl which is practically next door to this hotel as well. They made arrangements for us to do a Paramount Studios Tour and due to an error on the part of the clerk, we didn't get to go but they accommodated my son and I by booking us the Warner Bros Tour instead and it was FABULOUS!! Also, arranged the cab, which cost us about $15 each way. The room was so comfy and cozy - we were on the 5th floor and didn't hear anything from other rooms - The breakfast was great and such a bonus that it's included with your stay. We filled up on that and started our day! Great outdoor pool and never had an issue with waiting to use the computer in the Business Centre. Yes, you have to take a different elevator if you're staying higher than the 5th floor but seriously folks, in the big picture that should'nt stop you from staying here!! If I'm ever back in L.A. which I will be as I'm a huge fan now of the Nokia Theatre for seeing big name acts in smaller venues - I will always stay there. Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel, no street parking!”
Reviews.Author: tracys2cents
Reviews.Content: Please note that parking at this hotel is $25 per day which is pretty high for mid-range hotels in the area!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Hollywood Walk of Fame
